loans.name: Las Crucitas 0200082-10 Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Las Crucitas son originarios de la comarca del mismo nombre, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim.

Sebastiana del Rosario V. G. es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene una pulpería en la comarca, esta ha venido creciendo con los diferentes prestamos que se le han otorgado, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando mejoras en el negocio y mayor inventario.
Esta señora tiene un niño a cargo, él tiene una discapacidad, ella lo cuida y compra sus medicinas, el tener su negocio en su casa le favorece porque tiene su propio empleo y puede cuidar a su hijo, su marido le ayuda con los gastos pero ella se siente bien siendo dueña de su negocio.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.
texts.en:
The Las Crucitas group are from the region known by the same name. they have worked with Adim for several cycles, and they feel that the institution has shown trust in them. According to them, they feel like part of the Adim family. Sebastiana del Rosario V. Gaitan is the group coordinator. She has a small store in the area, which has grown with each new loan that she has received. She says that she has seen her business improve with each loan and with greater investment. She has a child in her care who has a disability. She cares for him and purchases his medicine. By having her business in her home she is able to be self employed and care for her child. Her husband helps her with the expenses, but she feels good being the owner of her own business. She is encouraged to keep working and to keep caring for Adim when she thinks of all that she has achieved. She shares this with her group and for this reason she is charged with delivering the payment to ensure that it is made on time.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Cristina,

texts.es:
Desde muy joven, María se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa desde que era muy joven. Sin embargo, siempre había trabajado solo para negocios de otras personas. Una vez que tuvo a su pequeña hija, abandono el trabajo para poder cuidar de ella. Pero la necesidad de tener un ingreso más para mantener el hogar. Hizo que volviera a retomar el negocio de la ropa, pero esta vez como un negocio propio.

Es así que desde hace dos años vende ropa bajo pedido. Además hace seis meses, gracias a las recomendaciones de una amiga cercana, empezó a vender también productos de belleza por catálogo. Ambos trabajos le permiten cuidar de su hija y de su hogar.

Los gastos le permiten dar un mejor cuidado a su hija en cuestiones de salud, educación y bienestar en general. Su esposo también la ayuda en cubrir los gastos de la casa y alimentos trabajando. Más adelante le gustaría abrir un puesto de ropa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria has been selling clothes since she was a very young girl but she always worked for other people. When her daughter was born she left her job in order to look after her but the need for her to earn an income to support her family meant that she had to start selling clothes again. However, this time she started her own business and this is how two years ago she began selling clothes to order. Furthermore, six months ago, thanks to the advice of a close friend, she also started to sell cosmetics by catalogue. Both her jobs allow her to look after her home and daughter, for whom she is now able to provide better, in terms of health, education and general well-being. Her husband, who also works, helps her to cover household costs and food as well. In the future, she would like to open a market stall selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Ivania Patricia

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Ivania G. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual es atendido todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana atendiendo a todos sus clientes muy amablemente.

La circunstancia que hoy en día ella atraviesa es que requiere del capital financiero para la compra de los productos y es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito y así mejorar su condición económica que hoy en día atraviesa.
texts.en:
Every day, in the market “La Terminal” in the city of León, Mrs. Ivania G. works at her grocery store business with much energy and dedication. Beginning in the early hours of the morning, she amiably attends to all her clients. Right now, her circumstances are such that she needs capital to finance the purchase of merchandise. For that reason she is turning to Ceprodel to obtain a loan so that she can improve her economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dora Eloisa

texts.es: La señora de Nombre Dora Eloisa U. Solís tiene la edad de 52 años, Doña Doris se dedica a la actividad económica de Doña Dora es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, y su negocio surgió por la necesidad de proporcionar ingresos para su familia y en la actualidad se siente orgullosa de este humilde oficio. Los propósitos de Doña Dora son de mantener a sus clientes ya que sin ellos no podría seguir con su negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así poder realizar las compras de ropa, calzado, toallas, perfumes, cremas y protector solar por la temporada de verano. El deseo de Doña Dora es mantener siempre su negocio y así brindarle satisfacción a sus clientes con diferentes productos. La cantidad que solicita es de C$17.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Eloisa U. Solís is 52 years old. She makes a living by selling general merchandise. She is an ambulatory salesperson. She started her business about 15 years ago because she needed to contribute money to support her family. Right now she is very proud of her humble job. Doña Dora's objective is to keep her current clients happy and coming back because without them her business would have never grown to what it is now. The financing that she is asking for will be invested in her business. She will purchase clothing, shoes, towels, perfumes, creams, and sun screen for the summer months. Doña Dora's dream is to always have her business and to please her customers with different products. She is requesting a loan of $850.

(Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ismael Velásquez tiene la edad de 67 años, habita en el barrio las Enramadas, junto a su esposa , ella es ama de casa el apoyo que recibe don Pedro es por parte de sus hijos ya que estos están casado y viven cada uno es sus vivienda , los planes hacia un futuro es comprar mas terreno para poder heredar partes iguales a sus hijos , desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación es la baja de producción por falta de fertilizantes y cuidos del mismo , el inicio por sus propios esfuerzos para lograr darles a sus hijos un techo y comida , el solicita el financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos y obtener una buena producción y vender a un buen precio en el mercado, este es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por las oportunidades y beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Ismael Velásquez is 67 years old and lives with his wife in the neighbourhood of Las Enramadas. She is a housewife. Sr. Pedro receives help from his children who are married and live in their own homes. His plan for the future consists of buying more land so that he can leave equal parts to his children. For the last thirty years he has been a farmer, with his main concerns being falling production caused by the lack of fertilizer and caring for his crops. When he started out, he worked really hard so he could provide his children with food and shelter. He is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and other needed items, in order to increase production and sell his crops for a good price in the market. This is his first loan with Kiva partner Afodenic, and he wishes to express his gratitude for this opportunity and help for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other needed items in order to increase the harvest

loans.name: María Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora María Zoraida posee su propio negocio  de venta de productos de uso domestico de diferentes usos vendidos en su tramo en el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León.

Es una dama con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio y comprometida en mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos por ser madre soltera. El motivo por el que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser bonificada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y así salir adelante en su negocio y en el mantenimiento de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Mrs Maria Zoraida has her own business selling various products for domestic use. She has a stall in the Market "La Terminal" in the city of Leon. She is very ambitious with her business and as a single mother is devoted to maintaining her three small children. She has asked Ceprodel for a loan to buy more products so that her business can prosper and so that she can continue maintaining her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for domestic use

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam R. se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 16 años siendo este su único negocio con el cual se sustenta diariamente.

Se ha caracterizado por ser una dama que ha sido una excelente trabajadora ya que trabaja en todo tiempo y siempre atiende a sus clientes muy amablemente. La situación que ella atraviesa hoy en día es que requiere de la compra de la ropa para comercializarla urgentemente y obtener las utilidades para continuar invirtiendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs Miriam R. has had a business selling second hand clothes for 16 years and it is this sole business that provides her daily income. She is an extremely hard-working woman, as she is always at work and she always attends to her customers in a friendly manner. The problem for her at the moment is that she urgently needs to buy more clothes so that she can sell them and obtain the needs to continue investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana Mercedes tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos ,  junto a sus hijos los cuales le apoyan con el trabajo agrícola después que ellos salen de clases , ella es una madre muy luchadora ya que le ha inculcado a sus pequeños la importancia del trabajo , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir su vivienda , ella desde hace quince años trabaja en la agricultura y al comercio , ella inicio con sus propios esfuerzos para poder darle alimento y educación a sus dos hijos , el préstamos que ella solicita es para la comprar de insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y tener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
38-year old Señora Ana Mercedes lives in the neighbourhood of La Francia 2 together with her children who help her with her work as a farmer when they get out of school each day. She is a very determined woman and has taught her young children the importance of hard work. Her future plans include finishing the building of her own home. For the last 15 years, she has worked in agriculture and business. Through her own efforts right from the beginning, she has managed to provide food and education for her children. The loan she is seeking is to buy fertilizer and other items to improve her fields, have a better harvest, and to sell her produce for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other items to improve her fields

loans.name: Salmo 23 Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Salmo 23 es originario del municipio de Catarina perteneciente a la Ciudad de Masaya, es uno de los mas cercanos a la capital, este es un lugar turístico, estas mujeres trabajan en diferentes actividades tres de ellas venden tortillas, las elaboran y venden en su casa, entregan a otras personas que ofrecen quesillos a los turistas ya que este es el complemento de este producto; la única que tiene una pulpería es doña Tania del Socorro.
Doña Celia es la coordinadora del grupo, este la eligió porque es muy responsable, ella es una mujer de 43 años, desde joven aprendió este oficio, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solamente dos viven con ella, sus hijos le ayudan a vender y elaborar las tortillas. Ella afirma que con el crédito ella ha incrementado sus ventas porque ahora tiene mas clientes y le queda un margen de ganancia mayor, después de cada crédito ella ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su taller. Ella ha sido beneficiada con las capacitaciones de Adim, estas le han servido para mejorar en la presentación de su negocio y personal, anima a las integrantes del grupo a quedar bien en sus pagos para seguir adelante, sueña con mejorar su vivienda y dar estudio a sus hijos. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, él trabaja en elaboración de artesanía en el pueblo vecino de Niquinohomo, expresa “pero la dueña de mi negocio soy yo y esto lo mío”
El grupo esta claro de que debe de ser puntual y solidario para seguir siendo beneficiaria de estos créditos porque en otro lugar no les prestan si no tienen garantías y por esto nunca habían trabajado con crédito.
texts.en:
The Salmo 23 group is based in the Catarina municipality in the city of Masaya. Because it is one of the closest cities to the capital, it is a tourist area. These women work in different activities; three sell tortillas which they make and sell from home to others who use them to make desserts which are sold to the tourists and go well with this product. The only one with a store is Ms Tania del Socorro. Celia is the group's coordinator. She was chosen because of her responsibility. She is 43 years old, and has learned her trade since she was young. She is the mother of 4 children, two of whom live with her. Her children assist in selling and in making tortillas. She says that through loans she has increased her sales as she has gained customers and increased her profit margin while improving conditions in her shop. She has benefited from the Adin trainings, which have helped her to improve the appearance of her and of her business. She encourages the members of the group to make their payments and progress. She dreams of improving her home and of providing her children with an education. Her husband helps her with the expenses of home, working as a craftsman in the neighboring town of Niquinohomo. She says "The business, however, is mine."The group understands the need for prompt payment and unity to keep enjoying the benefits of these loans, as no other organization will lend without collateral, the reason for which they have never worked with loans in the past.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Justina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es un negocio que requiere de mucha inversión por lo que a diario se vende el producto y se debe de estar llenando los estantes. Consciente de esta situación la señora Justina R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa de diferentes tamaños y para hombres y mujeres.

Por este motivo es que la señora Justina busca el apoyo en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado para dar lugar a la compra de la ropa y así ofertarla en su negocio.
texts.en:
Selling clothes is a business that requires a lot of investment because clothes need to sold on a daily basis and the rails always need to be full. Mrs Justina R., who has her own business selling clothes of different sizes for both men and women, is aware of this and as a result is looking to Ceprodel for support. She hopes that Ceprodel will grant her the loan she requires so that she can buy more clothes and help her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Sonia Aurea,

texts.es:
A sus treinta y un años, durante toda su vida ha trabajado en diversos negocios. Al inicio no propios pero mas adelante se dio cuenta que teniendo una microempresa generaba mas ingresos. Por lo que luego de ahorrar y planificar bien su proyecto, decidió abrir una panadería junto con su esposo. La idea nació no solo por las ganas de mejorar, sino también de sacar provecho al máximo a los conocimientos de su esposo sobre panificación adquiridos en sus diversos lugares de trabajo.

Con un hijo de doce años, Sonia pone todo de si para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio. Por ahora solo piensa en ir implementando más su local, con mercadería y mejor apariencia.
texts.en:
Sonia is thirty one and during her lifetime has had various jobs. At first she worked for other people but later she realised that having her own micro-business would generate more income. After saving and planning her business project, she decided to open a bakery together with her husband. The idea came when she decided she wanted to increase her income but also when she realised she could take advantage of her husband's baking knowledge acquired from working various jobs. With a twelve year old daughter, Sonia is giving it all she's got so that her business will continue to grow. At the moment, she is only thinking about improving her shop in terms of filling it with more produce and in terms of its appearance.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Roden-Scott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy produce

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es:
La señora Kari S. es una dama que desde cuatro años inició su negocio de pulpería con pocos ingresos pero que a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo logró mejorar las condiciones del negocio.

Ella es madre de dos pequeños hijos los cuales requieren de su apoyo y por ser madre soltera debe de brindarles todo lo que ellos requieren.
El motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos porque le urge adquirirlos a lo inmediato para ofertarlos.
texts.en:
Ms. Kari S. started her grocery store four years ago with limited resources. She has been able to improve its condition as the years pass.

Ms. S. has two small children who depend on her. She is a single mother and all their responsibility falls on her.

She is hoping to obtain a loan from Ceprodel to buy supplies for her store as soon as possible to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Lucrecia Margarita

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Lucrecia Q. se dedica con esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de cosmético siendo vendidos por ella misma en su localidad diariamente.

Sus inicios fueron muy duros porque estudiaba por las tardes y por las mañanas trabajaba con su mamá en la venta de cosas de horno siendo esta su labor cotidiana hasta que decidió afirmar un negocio el cual es el de venta de cosméticos. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los cosméticos para ofertarlos en su local.
texts.en:
In the "La Terminal" market of the city of León, Lucrecia Q. works at at her cosmetics sales business, selling her products herself every day from her stall. It was very difficult for her initially because she was studying in the evenings and working with her mother in the mornings selling items made of horn. This was her day's work until she decided to open her cosmetics sales business. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy cosmetics to retail at her stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Julia Estela,

texts.es:
Julia solo tiene un año con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO pero lo que ha obtenido gracias a ellos es mucho. Julia es una madre de familia llena de optimismo y entusiasmo al momento de pensar en su futuro.

Empezó trabajando como costurera en una empresa textil, sin embargo debido a una mala experiencia con el cuidado de sus hijos a cargo de otra persona, decidió renunciar y emprender un negocio que le permitiera estar cerca de sus hijos mientras trabajara, ya que ellos solo tienen diez, ocho y cuatro años. En ese entonces eran aún más pequeños. 
Por ello, pensó en vender comida. Con la liquidación de su trabajo en la empresa compro un carrito sanguchero, que es la herramienta principal para quienes venden frituras como ambulante. Durante dos años ha vendido sánguches, salchipapas y demás platos, ofreciendo más platos a medida que su clientela crecía también.

Ahora, esta llevando a cabo el sueño que tuvo desde que empezó con su negocio propio, tener una fuente de soda propia en su casa para poder vender no solo comidas sino también bebidas, ofreciendo una mejor atención a sus clientes. La construcción aun esta a medias, pero ella ya piensa en lo que vendrá después del término de ella: agrandar mas el local para abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Julia has been a client of EDAPROSPO for only one year but has made very good use of the loans. Julia is full of optimism and enthusiasm when she thinks of her future. She started working as a seamstress in a textile factory. Because she had a bad experience with the care provided to her children by someone else, she decided to leave her work and open a business which would allow her to be close to her children while she worked as they are only 10, eight and four years old. At that time they were even younger. Because of this, she thought to sell food. With the money from the severance from her work in the factory she bought a street cart which is her main tool from which she travels, selling fried foods. For two years she sold sandwiches, salchipapas [fried hot dogs with french fries] and other foods, offering more dishes as her clientele grew. She is now in the process of making her dream of owning her own business a reality: to have a soda fountain in her home in order to sell drinks as well as food and giving her clients better service. Construction is only halfway done, but she is already thinking of what will come after it is complete: she wants to expand in order to open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her new soda fountain

loans.name: Grupo Arco Iris Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Arco Iris está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la comarca Las Flores perteneciente al departamento de Masaya, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías.

Doña Flor de los Santos L. es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de ropa, vende en el mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua, ella vende ambulante porque ofrece a los visitantes ropa menor y no muy cara, ejemplo: calcetines y ropa interior de mujer. Trabaja todos los días menos el día Domingo, este día lo comparte con su familia.
Tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos le ayuda algunos días a vender, le está enseñando el negocio para que tenga un oficio pero su deseo es que termine sus estudios y pueda tener una vida diferente a la de ella, es madre soltera y le ha tocado muy duro el criar a sus hijos sola..Una de sus metas es mejorar su casa, está convencida que esto lo logrará cuando su negocio crezca y le de mejores ganancias. Expresa que ha aprendido a controlar mejor su negocio y está clara que es una empresaria. Aún pretende algún día no tener que hacer los oficios domésticos y dedicarse más a su negocio y brindar un empleo a otra mujer.
texts.en:
The Arco Iris (Rainbow) group is made up of 3 working women from the Las Flores region in the Masaya department. The began taking loans through Adim through referrals from customers who told them that the could obtain a loan without collateral. Ms Flor de los Santos Lopez is the group coordinator. She has a business selling clothing in the Roberto Huembes de Managua market. She works as a roving vendor, selling customers affordable clothing, including stockings and women's undergarments. She works every day but Sunday, which is the day that she shares with her family. Flor has two children, one of whom helps her to sell from time to time. She is teaching him the business so that he can have a trade, but her desire is that he finish school so that he can have a life different than her own. As a single mother, she has raised her children with much hardship. One of her goals is to improve her home, and she is convinced that she can do it once her business grows and gives her greater profit. She has said that she has learned to better control her business, and that she is a business woman. She hopes to one day be able to leave behind the domestic chores in order to give more time to her business and offer work to another woman.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Gloria Rodríguez C. tiene 44 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio enfermería Técnica, carrera que ejerció durante 3 años y que abandono debido a que salió embarazada, tiene 2 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella. 
Rosa se dedica a la venta de aves (pollo).  Hace 13 años, empezó vendiendo unos cuantos kilos ahora se ha hecho conocida y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido comprar el puesto donde vende. También se dedica al alquiler de taxis, empezó con uno y ahora tiene 5 que le dan  muchas ganancias. Su negocio se desarrolla en el mercado El Cortijo. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en aumentar su capital para la venta de pollo.
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de pollo para la venta y la compra de repuestos para sus taxis.
Rosa tiene el gran sueño de conocer el cuzco y tener una empresa de taxis.
texts.en:
Rosa Gloria Rodrígues C. is 44 years old. She lives in El Cortijo, in the district of Trujillo, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied technical nursing, a career that she practiced for three years but had to abandon when she became pregnant. She has two children that depend entirely on her.

Rosa sells poultry (chicken) and has done so for 13 years. She started selling a few kilos and now has become well-known and has many customers. With her earnings, she has been able to buy a stall to sell from. Also, she rents taxis. She began with one and now has five that bring her good income. Her business takes place in the El Cortijo market.

With her first loan of 300 soles ($100 USD) that she received from the community bank “Nuevo Perú,” she invested to increase her capital in poultry sales.

With this loan of 1700 soles ($550 USD), which will be paid off in six months, she will invest in the purchase of chicken for sale and spare parts for her taxis.

Rosa has a dream of going to Cuzco and having a taxi business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken in bulk. Purchase of spare parts for taxis.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
Nicaragua se caracteriza por ser una tierra donde todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras, tale s el caso de la señora María Luisa M. el cual elabora tortillas y las vende a diario para así mantener a su hijo por ser madre soltera.

Ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como lo es el maíz para elaborar las tortillas y por esta razón es que espera muy confiadamente para así dar lugar a la compra de esta materia primar para la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Nicaragua is known as a land where the women are very hardworking, such as María Luisa M. who makes tortillas and sells them daily in order to support her son as she is a single mother. She is looking for Ceprodel's help in the form of a loan to buy basic ingredients such as corn to prepare tortillas and because of this is very confident that she will be able to be in a position to buy this basic ingredient to make her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare tortillas

loans.name: Angela Maritza

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal en la ciudad de León la señora Ángela L. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en su propio establecimiento donde es visitada a diario por muchas personas.

Con el compromiso de brindar un buen producto al cliente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras para así ofertarlas y continuar buscando la manera de mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the market known as La Terminal in the city of León, Angela Lopez works diligently in the fruit and vegetable stand where she is visited daily by many people. With a commitment to provide the clients with a good product she has turned to Ceprodel to apply for a loan with which to buy the fruit and vegetables she will then offer to her clients, as she continues to look for ways to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Vicky Alejandrina,

texts.es:
En la actualidad, Vicky se encuentra en el séptimo mes de gestación de su tercer hijo. Sus dos hijos mayores ya tienen diecisiete y doce años. Debido a su estado, y también a la reciente construcción de su casa. Solo se dedica a un negocio de los dos que maneja por lo general.

Desde hace dos años tiene una bodega que por ahora no funciona ya que la construcción de su casa provocó que todas las cosas y productos de la bodega se guardaran en un lugar donde no pudieran dañarse. Una vez que haya dado a luz, Vicky piensa reinstalar las cosas de su bodega para retomar su rutina diaria.

Hoy en día solo se dedica a la venta de frituras en la puerta de su casa por las noches y todos los días. Más adelante quisiera surtir más en su tienda o de repente convertir el local en una fuente de soda donde pueda vender comida y bebida.
texts.en:
Vicky is currently in the 7th month of pregnancy of her third child. Her two older children are 17 and 12 years old. Because of her condition, and because of the recent construction of her house, she is only working in one of the two businesses that she usually runs. For the last two years Vicky has run a small store which is not currently operating, as the products had to be stored in a safe place during construction on her home. Once she has had her baby, Vicky plans on restocking her products to take up her daily routine once again. Currently she sells fried food from the door of her home in the evenings and during the day. She hopes to offer more products from her store in the future, or to convert the space to a soda fountain where she can sell food and drink.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic ingredients for food sales, and money for the birth of her child.

loans.name: Efrain Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Efraín Ernesto M. tiene la edad de 55 años, habita en la comunidad Medardo andino, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, pero solo a una hija de 19 años tienen a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Efraín se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y por otra parte las plagas le daña el cultivo. El inicio el trabajo agrícola por una cooperativa la cual le ofreció un proyecto y capacitación de cómo trabajar la tierra, pero este no les brindo el financiamiento requerido para el cultivo, en un futuro hacia su cultivo quiere diversificarla. El financiamiento lo va invertir en la comprar de insumos y fertilizantes para obtener mejores resultado con su cosecha.
texts.en:
55-year old Señor Efraín Ernesto M. lives with his wife in the community of Medardo Andino. She helps him by taking care of the household chores. They have four children, but are now only responsible for the care of their 19-year old daughter. Their future plans include improving the living conditions of their family. Sr. Efraín has been involved in agriculture for 25 years, and his biggest headaches are the inability to get credit and the pests that harm his crops. He began working in a farming cooperative on a project which provided training on how to work the land, but it did not provide the money required for crops. He wants to diversify into different crops in the future. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and other needed items so that he can get a better harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other needed items to improve his fields

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
La señora Mirna O. se ha destacado por vender los productos plásticos tales como bolsas de todo tipo, platos, vasos, cucharas y panas siendo este su negocio al que se dedica desde hace cinco años.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y para ello ha buscado la forma de mejorar buscando el refugio en Ceprodel el cual ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos plásticos ya que se le están agotando y requiere llenar sus estantes para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mirna O. has made herself stand out by selling plastic products such as all types of bags, plates, glasses, spoons and other common household items. She has worked selling plastic items for 5 years. With a good deal of effort, she has successfully improved her financial situation. After looking for the best way to accomplish this she has sought refuge with Ceprodel and is requesting a loan for the purchase of plastic products since she is running out of inventory. She needs to fill her shelves in order to continue satisfying her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic products

loans.name: Chapincita Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Chapincitas está  conformado por los señores: Doña María Nela vende leche, don Byron José vende gas butano en su barrio y doña María Elena es comerciante de cajetas, frescos y otras comidas. Son personas trabajadoras, originarias del municipio de Tisma, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, que viven en condiciones de vida humildes, llegaron a trabajar con Adim por una promoción que se hizo en la comarca y les gustó la forma de trabajar porque ellas no tienen garantías que dar para un crédito y en Adim se les dio confianza.

Doña María Nela G. es la coordinadora del grupo, la seleccionaron porque es muy responsable y solidaria con muchas personas de la comunidad, es profesora del colegio local, ella se dedica a la comercialización de leche, tiene un ganado de 4 vacas y tres terneros; así como gallinas, patos y cerdos. Vende la leche en la comunidad y en Masaya entrega la mitad de la producción.
Tiene dos hijos, es madre soltera y sueña con que sus hijos tengan una educación superior, es una de las metas principales de su vida, las edades de sus hijos son de 14 y 16 años, estos le colaboran con el negocio, uno de ellos va a entregar la leche a Masaya transportándose en bicicleta. Está muy orgullosa de su familia y de poder ayudar a otras personas.
Anima a su grupo a cumplir con sus pagos y así conservar el crédito con Adim, ella es una líder en su comunidad por sus logros, es humilde y luchadora.
texts.en:
The Chapincitas group is made up of Ms Maria Nela, who sells milk, Mr Byron Jose, who sell butane gas in his neighborhood, and Ms Maria Elena who sells candies, soft drinks, and other food items. They are hard workers, from the municipality of Tisma which is located in the Masaya department. They live in very humble circumstances, and they came to work with Adim because of a promotion done in the area. They appreciated the program, as they did not have collateral for a loan, but Adim showed faith in them. Ms Maria Nela G. is the group coordinator. She was chosen for her responsibility and relationships with many people in the community. She is a teacher at the local school, and she works selling milk. She has a herd of 4 cows and 3 calves, as well as chickens, ducks and pigs. She sells milk in the neighborhood and takes 1/2 of her production to Masaya. She is a single mother with two children and she dreams of giving her children higher education, which is one of the main goals that she has in life. The children are 14 and 16 years old, and they help out in the business. one takes the milk to Masaya by bicycle. She is very proud of her family, and is happy to be able to help others. She encourages her group to make their payments and to maintain their good credit with Adim. Maria is a leader in her community due to her accomplishments, and she is a humble hard worker.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Eleoteria Asuncion,

texts.es:
Eleoteria se dedica básicamente a la cocina. De lunes a viernes prepara almuerzo para trabajadores que laboran cerca a su casa. Lo especial de su trabajo es que no solo prepara la comida también se los lleva al lugar de trabajo de sus clientes, ganando la fidelidad de ellos y mas clientes. Por otro lado, los fines de semana ella cocina y vende tamales para el desayuno de sus vecinos. 

Por el momento y debido a que su esposo perdió su puesto de trabajo también trabaja ofreciendo servicio de limpieza en casas particulares, para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su  casa y además, de sus cuatro hijos aún menores, quienes tiene, catorce, doce, tres y un año.

En el futuro ella planea instalar una tienda en su casa o en el mercado de su localidad.
texts.en:
Eleoteria generally works in the kitchen. Monday through Friday she prepares lunch for those who work near her home. Her business's special feature is that she doesn't only make the food, but she also takes it to her customers' work sites, gaining their loyalty, and additional customers. On the weekends, she cooks and sells tamales to her neighbors for breakfast. Because her husband lost his job, right now she also works cleaning private homes in order to pay for the household expenses and to support her 4 minor children, ages 14, 12, 3 and 1. In the future she hopes to open a store in her home, or at the local market.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies and cooking supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Inca Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Inca está conformado por tres señoras, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, originarias de la comarca del mismo nombre del grupo, ubicada en el departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confíen en ellas, expresaron..
Son vecinas, de confianza, se conocen hace muchos años y son muy unidas. Doña Darling vende productos lácteos, doña Susana M. vende ropa ambulante y Doña Darling G. vende ropa y cosméticos ambulante.

Doña Darling E. G. es una joven de 28 años, casada, madre de tres hijos de las edades  5, 3 y un bebé de 2 meses. Doña Darling se dedica a la compra y venta de productos lácteos como : crema, queso, cuajadas, leche, etc., los cuales las va ha vender en el mercado de Masaya. Ella sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casita, puesto que actualmente vive con su suegra, hacer que crezca su negocio, y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Inca is made up of three women, all hard working women from the area of the same name as the group, located in the Masaya region. Their living conditions are humble. They all say they work with Adim because they trust the organization. These women are neighbors who trust each other. They have known each other for many years and are very close. Mrs. Darling E. sells dairy products, Mrs. Susana M. sells clothing in the streets and Mrs. Darling G. sells clothing and cosmetics, also in the streets. Mrs. Darling E. G. is 28 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, ages, 5, 3 and a 2 month old baby. Darling works buying and sellling dairy products such as cream, cheese, cuajada (a dessert made of curdled milk), milk, etc. She goes to the Masaya market to sell her products. She dreams of buying a plot of land where she can build a house. She currently lives with her mother in law. She also dreams of growing her business and giving her children a good education. This group is committed to pay punctually in order to continue receiving loans from Adim, They are confident that with this loan they wil move ahead by increasing their sales and as a result, their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Montañita #1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La montañita #1 está conformado por tres señoras originarias de la comarca del mismo nombre, son mujeres con excelente record crediticio, sus actividades son diversas, doña Martha Cecilia elabora y vende tortillas en su casa y destaza cerdo y vende nacatamales, doña Juliana vende ropa ambulante y zapatos, doña María Josefa vende ropa ambulante y tiene una pulpería en su casa.
Son conocidas en su comunidad por sus actividades, responsabilidad y honorabilidad.

Doña María Josefa F. es mujer de 37 años, nacida en el lugar donde vive, aprendió el oficio desde muy joven, su madre le enseñó; madre de tres hijos en edad escolar de edades adolescentes, ellos le ayudan en parte del proceso de preparación de las tortillas y en el destace del cerdo y elaboración de los nacatamales.Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja de celador en una empresa de alimentos.
Trabaja todos los días, el fin de semana trabaja en la venta del cerdo y los nacatamales. Expresa que se siente bien trabajando con Adim, porque se siente en confianza y le enseñan a mejorar en su negocio y su persona, antes ella era una persona que no sabía que su trabajo tenía mucho valor y en las capacitaciones aprendió muchas cosas nuevas, esto le ha animado a salir adelante con su negocio y a ser puntual con sus abonos, ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda y su lugar de trabajo, así como que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
The group La Montañita #1 is made up of three women from the region of the same name. They are women with an excellent credit record. They work in diverse businesses: Martha Cecilia makes and sells tortillas in her home and also slaughters pigs and sells nacatamales (corncakes stuffed with meat and vegetable and steamed in banana leaves), Juliana sells clothing and shoes in the street, and Maria Josefa sells clothing in the street and also has a convenience store in her home. All three are well known in their community for their businesses, their sense of responsibility and their honor. Mrs. María Josefa F. is 37 years old. She was born in the same place she currently lives. She learned her business when she very young, from her mother. She is the mother of three teenagers; her children help her prepare the tortillas, slaughter the pigs and prepare the nacamatales. Her husband helps her with the household expenses. He works for a food company as a security guard. She works every day. Weekends she works selling the pork and the nacamatales. She comments that she feels well treated by Adim because she feels among friends and Adim teaches her to improve her business and herself, as a person. Previously she was a person who did not know that her work had much value. In the training courses she learned a lot of new things. This has motivated her to move her business ahead and be punctual with her loan payments. She dreams of improving her home and her workplace. She also dreams that her children will complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in improving their businesses

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira tiene 64 años, vive con su hijo Javier de 28 años, los 4 restantes ya conformaron sus propias familias. Se dedica a la venta de comida en el pequeño restaurant que puso en su casa y donde atiende a la clientela que viene todos los días para degustar de sus ricos platillos, se viene dedicando a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, vendiendo diferentes platillos como pollo a la parrilla y chicharron, pero como la clientela va en creciente aumento, no se abastece en la atención, además también necesita tiempo para su criadero de cuyes, es por eso que una nuera la ayuda con mucha frecuencia con esto.  Como si fuera poco también ha incursionado en el alquiler de cuartos, ya que sus hijos se fueron dejando las habitaciones vacías, decidió aprovechar y darlas en alquiler. Edelmira espera poder seguir trabajando, ya que como ella dice: aún tiene fuerzas para dar mucho de sí, en el futuro le gustaría tener una bodega donde poder atender a la clientela sin tanto apuro y así entablar buenas amistades. Este es su 3er préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy  puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de alimentos para elaborar más platillos; con el resto del dinero arreglará y pintará algunos cuartos para darlos en alquiler y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
64-year old Edelmira lives with her 28-year old son Javier; her four other children have already left home and have their own families. She earns her living by selling food in the small restaurant she has opened in her home. There she attends her customers who come every day to eat her delicious meals. She’s been doing this work for 20 years, serving a variety of dishes such as barbecued chicken and chicharron (traditional pork dish). Now, as her client base is continuing to grow, she does not want to lower the quality of the service she provides. She also needs time to raise guinea pigs. It is for this reason that one of her daughters-in-law often comes to help with this task. As if that weren’t enough, she has also ventured into the business of renting out rooms—when her children left home, they left behind unused rooms, so she decided to take advantage of the situation and rent them out. Edelmira hopes to be able to continue working for some time; as she herself says she still has the strength to do a lot herself, but in the future she would like to have a small store where she can serve customers without rushing around and in the process make some good friends. This is her third loan with Kiva partner, Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has always been very punctual with her repayments. With the loan she will buy a greater quantity of food so she can make more dishes; with the rest of the money she will renovate and paint some rooms to rent out and in this way earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 57 años, es soltera vive con sus 6 hijos; Yobana de 34, Franco de 32, Pilar de 28, Ivan de 26, Luis de 24 y Blanca de 21 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a vender productos de belleza, y gracias a su buen trabajo la nombraron jefa de zona, del lugar en el que vive, ahora debe fomentar las ventas de sus demás compañeras, visitándolas constantemente. Además, vender sus propios productos, terminando muy cansada al final de día, pero aún así es muy feliz con su trabajo, ya que como ella misma dice, si dejara de trabajar se enfermaría. Es por eso que quiere crecer y ser cada vez mejor en lo que hace, felizmente las ventas son buenas y eso le recuerda cuando comenzó vendiéndo sus productos a sus hijos y ahora tiene muchos pedidos de sus amigas. Elena quiere seguir progresando y espera seguir escalando en su trabajo, pero también sabe que para ello hace falta mucha dedicación y más trabajo, por ello quiere volver a incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropa que realizó hace muchos años atrás y lo cual le de mayores ingresos. Ella ha tenido varios préstamos con Microfinanzas Prisma, gustándole mucho su banco comunal porque todas son buenas amigas y son puntuales en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más productos de belleza y además ropa para vender.
texts.en:
57-year old Elena is a single mother with six children: Yobana aged 34, Franco aged 32, Pilar aged 28, Ivan aged 26, Luis aged 24, and Blanca aged 21. They live together in their own house. She earns her living by selling beauty products, and because of her dedication she has been named area supervisor in the community where she lives. Now she has the job of encouraging her colleagues to increase their sales by visiting them regularly. All this in addition to her own sales leaves her very tired by the end of the day. However, she is still very happy doing this work—as she herself says, if she stopped working she would become ill. It is for this reason she wants to expand the business and continue improving in what she does. Fortunately business is good, and that makes her remember what it was like when she started out…selling products to her children. Now she gets many orders from her friends. Elena wants to continue this progress and get further promotions, but she also knows that it will take a lot of dedication and more work. So she wants to get back into the business of selling clothes which she used to do many years ago and which gave her a better income. She has had several loans with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma, and really likes the community bank because the members are good friends and punctual in their repayments. With the loan she will buy more beauty products and also clothes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo Rodolfo de 37 años y sus hijas Kimberly de 10 y Niurka de 4 años de edad, viven en su casa propia. Su profesión es la enfermería, pero desde hace 10 años, adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de ropa, compra las prendas al por mayor y se las manda a su madre, la cual vive en provincia para que las pueda vender a un mayor precio, resultando un negocio muy rentable para las dos. A Luz le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite pasar más tiempo con su hijas, las cuales son su adoración, ella quiere brindarles un buen futuro y que sean profesionales de éxito, para eso necesita trabajar mucho, es por eso que ha pensado en expandir su negocio y poner un bazar donde ofrezca más variedad de prendas, regalos, etc. Luz tiene un espacio en su casa para que pueda funcionar su tienda, pero necesita darle el acabado final e implementarlo con más mercadería. Luz lleva varios años trabajando con Microfinanzas Prisma, es la tesorera de su banco comunal, pero ahora solicita un préstamo individual, el cual espera pagar tan puntualmente como siempre. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de prendas de vestir para mandarlas a provincia y así lograr mejores ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
37-year old Luz lives with her 37-year old husband Rodolfo and their daughters Kimberly (10) and Niurka (4) in their own home. She works in an infirmary, but for the last ten years she has also sold clothing. She buys the items wholesale, then sends them to her mother who lives out in the countryside where she can sell them for a good profit. The result is a money-making business for them both. Luz likes the work as it enables her to spend more time with her daughters whom she loves dearly. She wants to provide them with a good future so they can have successful careers, but that requires much work. For this reason she is considering expanding her business and opening a store where she can offer a greater variety of clothes, gift items etc. In her home Luz has a space that could work as a store, but it needs some finishing touches and more stock bought. Luz has worked for Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma for several years and is the treasurer of the community bank. But now she herself needs a loan which she expects to pay back punctually as she always does. With the loan she will buy more clothing to send to her mother in the countryside and thus earn more money for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa P. has been a member of Paglaum since 2000. She is married and has two children. She lives in Kauswagan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman and fishing is their income source. She dreams that her two children will finish their studies some day.

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fishing net and fishing gear. With enough savings, she also wishes to purchase an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and fishing gear

loans.name: Simoneides

texts.en:
A 30-year-old, Simoneides "Simon" M. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. His father industriously cares for their photography business and he works for his father as an assistant.

The business is doing well. Simon personally took charge of their business when his father got sick. When he was challenged by financial difficulties, he has sought assistance from Paglaum. With his first loan, in 2008, he was able to purchase computer equipment and photography materials.

Now, Simon sees a good opportunity to venture into a new business for added income. He is requesting PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative to buy salon supplies and accessories. He deeply wishes for a good return from their photography and salon businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional salon supplies and equipment

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gliceria P. is 39 years old, married, and a resident of Maikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She has four children who are in school. Her husband is a soldier.

Four years ago, Mrs. P. was a normal housewife who was taking care of her children while her husband was assigned to faraway places. Gliceria realized that she needed to do something to help her husband to raise the money that they will need to send their children to college. Therefore, she opened a sari-sari (variety) store in Tudela market with a little starting capital.

A friend told her about Paglaum MPC's program and services and she grabbed the opportunity to become a member. In December 2004, she borrowed her first loan. Now she's applying for a ninth loan of Php 25,000.00 with a very good loan repayment history. The loan proceeds have helped her to expand her store, especially her meat shop venture. She yearns to have a decent life in which her children finish college and her business continues to grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for meat shop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
In the town of Aloran, in Misamis Occidental, lives a certain Mrs. Teresa M.. She is 38 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Her husband is a fisherman. Day abnd night, her husband works very hard to catch fish. Sometimes she helps her husband to dispose of the fish.

She became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in April 2006. She was interested in the loans, savings, and insurance that the coop offered. Being a member, she's thankful that, with the help of her husband, she was able to meet the needs of her family.

Now a problem has come up. Their pump boat was damaged and it will need a major repair. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000. She's hopeful that someday, with the help of the Almighty God, she will be able to install electricity in their house and buy a fishing net.

loans.use: To repair and repaint a pumpboat that is used for fishing

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia G., 54 years of age, is a widow with six children.  She's struggling to support her children on her own.  She engages in selling vegetables, spices, and root crops in the market.  She asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC as additional capital for her existing business. Patricia hopes to live a comfortable life with all her children established in their own careers.

loans.use: To purchase spices, vegetables, and root crops to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Mrs. Jasmin R. is married to Antree, a carpenter. The couple is blessed with two children, both in school. Jasmin became a member of Paglaum MPC under their Individual program in 2005. She has had previous loans from Paglaum MPC usually for additional capital for her Furniture Shop that she started long ago. She is now on her eighth loan, this one for Php 10,000.00. She will use her present loan to purchase of materials like woods, nails, varnish, glass and many others.

The couple wishes to expand their shop but they need more people to help her husband and capital to fill the customer's orders. Her children are already in college; she wants them to be able to finish their courses. She added, while I’m still a member of the Cooperative, I strive hard and be a MIGS member so I can access credit easily and hopefully all my dreams will be achieved. She is very grateful that she's one of the members of PMPC and has an opportunity to use KIVA services too.

loans.use: To buy woods, varnish, glass & nails

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana P., 29, is married with two children. She sells food to the general public six days a week.

She has no previous loans with SPBD. Susana expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Susana’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase boxes of mutton flaps, boxes of drumstick, bunch of bananas, sack of taros.

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en: Tagi L., 36, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience selling clothing to the general public. Her business is open 7 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with South Pacific Business Development (SPBD). She will use her loan to purchase poplins, paints, elei design boards, rollers, ie lavalava materials, and paint brushes. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 WST (~ $335 US).  SPBD loans are Tagi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Materials needed to make clothing

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mr. Phally S. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Chhoem Chanthon, is a rice farmer who works their plot of land and also breeds pigs. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Although they work hard, they have not been able to improve their family home. Thus, Mr. Phally S. has decided to ask for a loan to add to their savings so they can buy cement, sand, and other construction supplies needed to work on the house.  His wife is present in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and other construction supplies

loans.name: Leataosina

texts.en: Leataosina I., 42, is married with 2 children.  She has been in the vegetable business for one year. She sells to the village people and the public, 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with South Pacific Business Development (SPBD).  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 WST (~ $115 US).  SPBD loans are Leataosina’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor L. is a villager in Khlaung Tvea village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell. The additional profits will be used to support her family.

Her husband, Mr. Pha Soeung, is a farmer who cultivates rice on his own piece of land. This couple has seven children. Four of them are employed in a shoe factory. Another stays at home to look after the housework and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit

loans.name: Evelinime

texts.en:
Evelinime T., 32, is married with one children.  She has one year of experience in the pork buns business.  She sells to village people and the general public five days per week. 

Evelinime will use her loan to buy tools and things to start her business.  She expects her weekly net cash flow will be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  

SPBD loans are Evelinime’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy tools to start her business.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha S. was born in 1961 and lives in Khlaung Tvea village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.

She is a widow with two children, one is employed with a company and the other attends school.

Pha is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy piglets and build a piggery for breeding, to earn more income to support her family.

loans.use: Buy piglets and build a piggery.

loans.name: Maofa

texts.en:
Maofa T., 62, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the general store business. She sells to the public six days per week.

Maofa has had three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Maofa’s only access to capital because she was not able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Maofa will use her loan to buy timber, cement, roofing materials and all the things used for home improvement.

loans.use: Buy home improvement supplies.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him K. lives in Prey Dork Pong village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice.

Her husband, Non Voeun (right in photo), is a construction worker.

Him is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living.

She is 53 years old and the mother of four children. Two are employed in a garment factory. Another stays at home to do housework. The youngest attends a local school.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Kolap

texts.en:
Kolap P. is a villager in Chus village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Sam Seng, is an employee.

Kolap is applying for a loan to add to her savings to purchase timber to build a house for her family.

She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the picture.

loans.use: Buy timber to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Poy C. is 37 years old and she lives in Roka village, in Takeo province. She is a rice soup seller. Her husband, Phen Uy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a palm juice collector.

Although they try to work hard, they don't earn enough income to provide a better house for their family. In order to solve this problem, Poy decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a house.

She has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Add her savings to buy timber to build the house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D., 41, is married to Rolando D. and a mother of two. She lives in Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental in Southern Philippines.

She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Evelyn's husband is a school maintenance worker. They started Evelyn's business with their own money. Evelyn really works hard to meet the needs of the family and for the schooling of her children.

Evelyn wants a loan from HSPFI (KIVA Partner) amounting to PHP 14,000 to buy additional stock for her store. This will be her fourth loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Ready to Wear/RTW is one of the most in demand businesses, here in Misamis Oriental. Helen M. is one of those businesswoman striving to sell more RTW products.

Helen is 35 years old. She is married and has one child to care for and give support. Her husband is engaged in vehicle repair. Helen dreams that she will be able to send her daughter to school and to college so she can earn a decent job someday.

That's the very reason Helen is doing the business. She was able to start her business with a small amount of capital. And now, Helen wants to expand. She joined the microfinance program of HSPFI. Helen needs additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase RTW in volume.

loans.use: To purchase volume of RTW for sale.

loans.name: Shinoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinoun N. is a villager in Kok Romeat village in Kandal province. She was employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Rum Kam Sean, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Shinoun N. is applying a loan to add to her savings to buy clothes to resell to earn income. She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Sunema

texts.en:
Sunema M. is 46 years old and married with five children. She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people /public two days per week. She will use her loan to buy tools and chemicals for her plantation as well as improve her home.

This is Sunema’s first loan with SPBD, which provides her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala ($166 USD).

loans.use: To purchase tools to be used for her business and chemicals to kill insects.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Mrs. Khorn S. is a farmer in the Thkouv Village of Takeo Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice and also sells Khmer cakes. She is a 37-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is an employer while the other is a motor taxi driver. Although her children have careers, they still do not have much money to support their household. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Khorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for a pig breeding business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding

loans.name: Leitu

texts.en:
Leitu F. is 42 years old and married with six children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people /public two days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase farming equipment for her plantation. 

Leitu has had one previous loan with SPBD; these loans are her only access to capital because she has been unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala ($105 USD).

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment such as an axe, spade, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy C., 37, has been selling fish to her neighbors in the village for years. She takes care of three children who are no longer in school. All of them are employed as garment workers in the garment industry. The family lives in Phnom Penh City.

Tuy C. currently makes a daily income of $3 from her business. Her husband works as a carrier in the fish market. C.'s family's living conditions are not so good, because their house frequently needs repair. C. has applied for a loan to add to her savings to repair her house and to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: Repair her house and buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak R. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She is 47 years old and the mother of six children, one is employed in a garment factory, one stays at home to do housework, and the others are enrolled in the local school.

Her husband, Mr. Him Hak, is a palm juice collector. He is presented in the picture with her. Mrs. Nak R. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy timbers to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: Buy timbers to build a better house

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret C. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school. Mrs. Ret C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Him Eng, is a cow middleman. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it, but he does not have money for this purpose. To solve this problem, Mrs. Ret C. decided to ask for a loan to buy five more cows for her husband’s business. She hopes this will increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy five cows for her husband’s business

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa T. L., 26, is married with one child. She has two years of experience in the pork cake business. She sells to the village people  and public six days per week. She has had one previous loan with Kiva's partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145). SPBD loans are Lisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of flour, sugar and other items for her business

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun S. was born in 1961 and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a rice soup seller. Her husband, Mr. Hong Kem, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although this couple work hard, they still earn insufficient  income to support their household. To improve their standard of living, Mrs. Kun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 piglets and pig meal for her pig breeding business. She would use the rest of the money to dig a well for her family. She has three children. One is employed in a garment factory, another uses the horse and cart to transport  goods and passengers, and the youngest one is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy 10 piglets and pig meal for her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of flour, sugar, onions, yeast and an oven.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Tha N. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She breeds pigs and chickens. Since her pig breeding  business is doing well, she wants to expand it by buying more piglets and pig meal, and expand the piggery. She also needs the money to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khem May, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a   palm juice collector. Mrs. Tha N. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the third  attends the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and  pig meal, expand the piggery, and to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang S. is 55 years old and she lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are growing bigger, she needs money to buy pig meal to support her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this  purpose. She would use the rest of the money to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chea Saroeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He also is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Sang S. has three children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the other attends the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pig meal for her pigs, and to buy two cows for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema S., 33, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the fishing and fishmonger business. She sells to the villagers and public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 Tala (27USD).  SPBD loans are Tumema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy timber and cement for home improvement and the rest will used for other purposes.

loans.use: To buy timber and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Lonh C. is a villager living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, where she earns a living selling Khmer noodles. Since she started this business, she has gained more income because she cooks tasty food, sells at a better price, and  communicates well with her fellow villagers. She lives with her child and her husband, who sells fish at the market. Because Mrs. C.'s house is too small, she has decided to ask for a $500 loan that, added to her savings, will allow her to build a new stone house.

loans.use: To build a new stone house

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Mrs. Aun S. was born in 1972 and she lives in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Sao Dorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a motor taxi driver. Although they both work, they still earn too little income to support their family. So Mrs. Aun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig meal for a pig breeding business. She has five children. Four are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young for school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig meal  for her pig breeding  business.

loans.name: Foilagi

texts.en: Foilagi V., 55, is married with 7 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~140 USD).  SPBD loans are Foilagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay her children's school fees and also to buy timber and cement for home improvement.

loans.use: To pay school fees and also to buy timber and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Theary

texts.en: Mrs. Theary N. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She runs a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Phoeung Sophak, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also an ice-cream seller. Mrs. Theary N. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorcycle for her husband to  use for his ice cream selling rounds. She would use the rest of the money to buy pig meal and piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase the family income and improve her family's living conditions. She is 27 years old and the mother of four children. One goes to the local school while the others are still very young. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a motocycle for her husband to transport ice cream to sell; to buy pig meal and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Tineleti

texts.en: Tineleti T., 37, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in making and selling pancakes. She sells to the villagers 5 days per week. She has no previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about 68 USD).  SPBD loans are Tineleti’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil and a large frying pan for the pancake business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients like sacks of flour, sugar, gallon of oil and a large frying pan.

loans.name: Leitu

texts.en: Leitu A., 56, is married with five children. She has less than one year of experience in a donuts business. She will sell her donuts to school children and village people five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $200 USD). SPBD loans are Leitu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients needed to start her donut business, such as sacks of flour, sugar, oil, yeast and an oven.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast and an oven to start her donut business.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Khim Ou Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people living in Mkak village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sok Khim O. is the 22-year-old village bank president. She is a chicken middle-woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kuy Heng Long, is a farmer wH. owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sok Khim O. has a child wH. is just two years old.

loans.use: Purchasing more chickens to resell.

loans.name: Srei Chaim Ith Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Srei Chaim I. is the village bank president of twelve people who live in Mkak village, in Takeo province. Each loan will be for different purposes.

She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Srei Chaim also is a fruit seller. Her husband, Sap Key, is a Tok Tok taxi driver. Although they try to work hard, they earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Srei Chaim decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to start a breeding business.

Srei Chaim hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions wI. this loan. She is 25 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Buy piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta P., 38, is married with 5 children. She has 2 years of experience in a fishing business. She sells to village people and the public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (approximately $80 USD). SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a new canoe to replace the old one, some fishing equipment and a torch.
