This has been going well for her, since she can take advantage of the chance to sell "pagnes" to her customers. Having an insufficient stock of "pagnes", she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 15 lengths of high quality "pagne" and 30 bolts of fabric.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and fabric

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta Basent is in the business of selling maize flour and is requesting a loan to build a store from which she can sell the flour.  Asunta is thirty-six years old. Her husband is a peasant. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build lodges and a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a store for selling maize flour

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’Avédji, elle exerce depuis 1998 le commerce de miel, elle est dans son quartier la seule à vendre du miel, ce monopole lui permet  de réaliser d’important bénéfices, parfois même les habitants des quartiers voisins se déplacent pour acheter chez elle. Son stock actuel de miel ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES et elle demande son deuxième crédit pour acheter 30 bidons de miel. Elle est mariée mais n’a pas d’enfant.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Avédji district and since 1998, she has been selling honey. In her district she is the only one who sells honey, and this monopoly allows her to make a good profit. Sometimes, people who live in neighboring districts take the trouble to come to buy her honey. Her present stock of honey does not allow her to respond to the needs of her clientele. She has already had one loan from WAGES and she is now asking for her second to buy 30 containers of honey. She is married but has no children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of honey

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is currently in the business of selling bowls,cups, plastic plates, etc. at the shop and is requesting a loan to open up a department store.  Mary is twenty-four years old. Her husband is a clerk. She has two children who both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a supermarket. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a department store

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina L. is in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for her cakes. She is twenty-two years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has two children and they both go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients for baking cakes

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: En  2000, B. Abla a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois, elle vend à ses clients en gros et en détail, actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est élevée, raison pour laquelle elle demande à WAGES un crédit qui lui permettrait d’acheter 10 sacs de charbons de bois. Elle est mariée à un menuisier et mère de 02 enfants. Dès fois le revenu de son mari ne couvre pas la totalité des charges de la famille, c’est donc avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle contribue aux dépenses du foyer.
texts.en:
In 2000, Abla B. began to sell charcoal. She sells to her customers, both wholesale and retail. Presently, the demand of her clientele is high, and for that reason she is asking WAGES for a loan that will allow her to buy 10 sacks of charcoal. She is married to a carpenter and is the mother of 2 children. Sometimes her husband's income is not sufficient to cover all the expenses of the family, and it is her business income that makes up the difference.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Sirena

texts.en:
Sirena sells souvenirs, gift sets and other retail items in the central market in Beregovo. She usually offers a big variety of merchandise for sale in her vending kiosk. Sirena has been in business for about five years. Currently, she has about $2000 in turnover capital. Her net profit is about $270. 

Sirena dreams of developing her business and becoming more independent. She would like to get a loan of $200 to buy more goods for her business. She believes that additional income will help her develop her business to the point that she will be able to complete her mortgage payments on the business. 

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 6 weeks.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline A. is in the business of selling bananas and guava and is requesting a loan to buy more fruit to sell.  She is thirty years old and a widow. She has four children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Aniko

texts.en:
Aniko is an entrepreneur selling children’s clothing and footwear in one of the local markets of Beregovo called “Progress”. She started her business seven years ago. Since then she has increased her turnover capital to $2350. Presently, Aniko has about $390 in income. 

Aniko’s type of business has its own unique niche in the marketplace of Beregovo. She doesn’t face much competition which helps her business remain stable among other small businesses. Aniko is requesting a loan of $225 to increase her turnover capital for the spring season.  

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in 6 weeks.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia G. is in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open a bakery. She is 38 years old. Her husband is a peasant. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Cicilia hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Emerida

texts.en:
Emerida D. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Emerida is 27 years old and is married to a nurse. She has three children who all go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a bar

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a widow. She raises her teenage son all by herself. Oksana sells women’s clothing in the local markets of three little towns in the Stryi region – Dolina, Bolekhiv and Skolye. Variety of merchandise and reasonable prices are some of the factors which have promoted the success and rapid growth of Oksana’s venture. She got involved in the trade 13 years ago. Currently, she has about 15,000 Grivnas in inventory.

Oksana knows she is the only one who can help her son get settled in life. She is trying to do all she can to set a firm foundation and provide a decent education for him. Moreover, Oksana is hoping to continue helping her mother and mother-in-law. This is why she is working hard to keep her business running and making profit.

This time Oksana is seeking a loan for 11,000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise, e.g. skirts, pants and capris for the coming spring season.

loans.use: To purchase skirts, pants, capris

loans.name: Madronio

texts.es: El Cliente, Sr. Madronio R., es propietario de una despensa y ademas se dedica a la venta de menudencias con una antigüedad de mas de 7 años en el ramo.  El es residente en la ciudad de San Santa Rosa. El vive en su domicilio propio y es padre de 1 hijo menor de edad.  El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías para la despensa, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
The client, Mr. Madronio R., owns a small grocery store and also sells giblets and other animal parts. He has been in this line of work for more than seven years. He lives in his own home in the city of San Santa Rosa, and he is the father of one young child. He plans to use his loan money to buy merchandise to restock his grocery store so that he can earn more for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to restock store

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a married father of two kids – daughter Zhanetta and son Yuryi. His family lives in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. To support his family, Yuryi runs a fishing gear sales business in the central market of his home town. There are very few other entrepreneurs working in this sphere of trade. Yuryi has been running this venture for 7 years already. Presently, he has 20,000 Grivnas in inventory. His net profit amounts to 3,500 Grivnas a month. 

One of Yuryi’s plans is to open one more vending location in Vinogradovo. Knowing Yuryi’s determination and focused approach, we can say he will do his best to achieve the set goal. One of the steps leading to this achievement is the steady growth of Yuryi’s turnover capital and additional income as a result. In pursuit of his goal Yuryi is seeking a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to increase assorted merchandise in his kiosk for the spring season.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina R. is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to buy more cows for milk production. Zeina is 40 years old and is married to her husband who is a cattle keeper. She has 4 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a paddock system for rearing animals.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more cows for milk production

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married with four children. He sells clothing at the central Market in Beregovo city. His average monthly profit is 3,500 UAH.

Anatoliy has been in this business for 5 years. He decided to start this business because his mother had a similar business at another market in the same city. Now he has got a very good location that brings many clients to his kiosk. He offers his clients good quality products that allow him to make good sales. Anatoliy is a very organized and hard working person; he pays his loans back and on time.

Anatoliy would like to receive a loan of 8,000 UAH to increase the assortment of goods. He hopes that this will help him to increase his sales and make more profits.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Evdochia

texts.en:
Evdochia is a very hardworking woman because she loves her job. In childhood she went through many difficult moments, and now it is much easier for her to survive. Evdochia cares for her 3 children. Evdochia has a small business in the central market of Kagul town where she sells children's clothing. She rents a table at the market from a friend, and she pays rent monthly. At the moment, sales have fallen for some months so she only has money for payment of the monthly rent. She still wants to increase the stock of goods because she has the opportunity to buy merchandise at a very reasonable price in the city of Odessa.

Thus, Evdochia will pay the monthly payment to her friend and then have the profits needed to support their children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin I. is currently in the business of selling cakes and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Benjamin is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’adidogomé, G. yawa est une femme mariée qui vit avec son époux et ses 03 enfants dans le quartier d’adidogomé. Cette  dame a ouvert depuis 1995 une boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS MAWUNYO », dans sa boutique elle fait le commerce de céréales, de produits d'alimentation générale,de charbons  de bois et d’huile. Elle est très connue dans son quartier grâce  à ses  prestations. Actuellement son stock s’épuise, ayant déjà obtenu son premier crédit elle demande son deuxième pour acheter 02 sacs de céréales, 03 bidons d’huile rouge, 10 calebasses d’igname et 05 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Yawa G. lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood with her husband and their three children. In 1995, she opened a shop called "ETS MAWUNYO" where she sells cereals, groceries, charcoal, and oil. She's well-known in her neighborhood, thanks to her performance. Her stock is running out, and so she's seeking a second loan to buy 2 sacks of cereals, 3 cans of "red oil" (palm oil), 10 "calebasses" (containers made out of hollowed out and dried calabashes) of yams, and 5 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals, palm oil, yams, and charcoal

loans.name: Villa Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité se siente a gusto trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya. La mayoria de las mujeres son vecinas del barrio y en muchas ocasiones realizan actividades en conjunto. Las señoras del comité mantienen un estrecho relacionamiento. Las integrantes reciben un promedio de 400.000 mil guaranies, el cual van a invertir para la compra de sus mercaderias para venta e insumos para elaboración de sus productos. 

Las mujeres se muestran agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya que ofrece oportunidades de crecimiento para sus pequeñas actividades, pues asi pueden lograr una mejor calidad de vida. El comité demuestra responabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas como tambien con el ahorro. Las mujeres se comprometen a seguir trabajando con responsabilidad y honestidad, para el logro de sus metas. 

Carmen I. 	Despensa
Graciela B. 	Cria y Venta de pollos
Maria T.	        Venta de verduras
Victoria D.	Kiosko
Margarita C.	Venta de verduras
Lucila G.	        Lavandera
Maria D.	        Comerciante
Luz Maria Irigoirtia	Venta de frutas
Maria Cristina D.	Comerciante
Wilma I.	        Limpiadora
Mariza G.	        Venta de verduras y frutas
Gloria T.	        Venta de Verduras y bijouteri
Claudia P.	        Venta de verduras y comestibles
Juana G.	        Lavandera
Gloria L.	        Venta de comestibles
texts.en:
This group is happy to be working with Fundación Paraguaya. Most of the women are neighbors, and often do activities together. The women in the group maintain a close relationship with one another. The group members are each receiving an average of 400,000 guaraníes (US$78), which they will use to buy more merchandise to sell and ingredients to produce their products. The women are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for offering them the opportunity to expand their small businesses, because this will help them gain a better quality of life. The group has been responsible with their previous payments and savings accounts. The women are committed to continue working with responsibility and honesty, in order to achieve their goals. Carmen I. Grocery store Graciela B. Chicken breeding and sales Maria T. Vegetable sales Victoria D. Kiosk Margarita C. Vegetable sales Lucila G. Laundry Maria D. Merchant Luz Maria Irigoirtia Fruit sales Maria Cristina D. Merchant Wilma I. Cleaning Mariza G. Fruit and vegetable sales Gloria T. Jewelry and vegetable sales Claudia P. Food and vegetable sales Juana G. Laundry Gloria L. Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, food and materials for production/sale (fruits, vegetables, jewelry, clothing, lingerie, rice, drinks, sweets, sugar, soap, containers, etc.)

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail is a very honest and responsible man at his job, and he performs it well. He likes cars, and he is familiar with all the details of a motor vehicle. Three years ago, Mihail opened a car wash that is famous in his town. For 3 years he has managed to attract quite a few clients who trust the services provided by Mihail. This year he has decided to expand his business by supplementing the equipment necessary, such as a water pressure device, technical clothing, chemicals and other things, so that customers will have a desire to use Mihail's services in the future .

He decided to borrow a loan Microinvest to buy the necessary equipment and materials.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and materials.

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.en:
The “3 de mayo” Village Bank is made up of 17 members who live in Poroy, a small town on the outskirts of Cusco, Peru, located at 3,670 meters above sea level. The area is often quite chilly, but the surrounding countryside is very beautiful, with rolling green hills as far as the eye can see. 

The group meets once a month in a small adobe house belonging to one of its members, where guinea pigs, chickens, a kitten and two puppies often run underfoot. The group members are involved in a variety of businesses and will use their loans for different purposes. Several women raise small animals (like chickens, guinea pigs or sheep) and will use the money to buy more animals or fatten up animals they already have; two women have market stands, where they sell different varieties of potatoes, corn and beans, and will buy sacks of potatoes to sell; one man is a taxi driver and will use his loan for car repair; another is an electrician and will use his loan to buy more tools and materials; one woman makes prepared meals, which she sells in a local market, and will buy vegetables and a sack of rice; another woman knits sweaters and tablecloths and will use the loan money to buy thread and yarn; and another woman makes dental prosthetics, and will use the money to buy more materials for her work. 

This is the group’s second loan cycle with Asociacion Arariwa. All of the group members are bound by a mutual guarantee, and have pledged to repay this loan in full and on time.

loans.use: Buy small animals, potatoes, yarn and thread, rice, vegetables, electrical supplies, tools, and pay for car repair

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El señor Lino C. vive en casa alquilada, en la zona  las Delicias, ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Elizabeth Valdez.
El señor Lino trabaja como Gastrónomo, atendiendo reuniones sociales particulares y su esposa es ama de casa.
Con sus ahorros, el señor Lino realizó la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad de El Alto, al oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
 El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de dos habitaciones nuevas en su propiedad.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Lino C. lives in a rented house in the zone of "las Delicias" ["the Delights"], a hill north of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, Elizabeth Valdez. Lino works as a food critic, attending in particular social gatherings. His wife is a housewife. With his savings, Lino was able to buy a plot of land in the city of El Alto, a city to the west of La Paz. The loan that Lino is requesting is for the contruction of two new rooms on his property. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis that was performed favorably qualified him so that he can access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two new rooms on his property

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito Ramos M. vive en casa propia, en la zona  8 de Diciembre, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, viviendo solo ya que tuvo que separarse de su esposa y actualmente mantiene a sus tres hijos.
El señor Benito trabaja como albañil, realizando construcciones para personas particulares.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una nueva habitación ya que sus hijos están creciendo y se ve en la necesidad de proporcionarles un espacio para su desenvolvimiento.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Benito Ramos M. lives in his own home, in the zone called 8th of December, on the west side of the city La Paz. He lives alone now that he has separated from his wife, and he currently supports his three sons. Señor Benito works as a bricklayer, completing construction projects for individual people. The loan that he is asking for is for the construction of a new house now that his sons are raised and he sees the need to give them space that his is not involved with. This is the fifth time that he has asked for a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis shows that he is well qualified and able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a new house for Benito's sons

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana P. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Pascual Apaza y sus tres hijo.
La señora Juana tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa textil de esta ciudad.
El crédito solicitado es para el acabado de la construcción de su tienda, así como la construcción de una habitación (trastienda) para el deposito de su mercadería.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado les califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señora Juana P. lives in her own home in the zone called Las Lomas, on the west side of the city La Paz, with her husband, Señor Pascual Apaza, and their three children. Señora Juana has a neighbourhood store in her home, and her husband works as an employee of a textile factory in the city. The loan that she is asking for is to finish the construction of her shop, for the construction of a room (the back room of the shop) where she stores her merchandise. This is the second time that they have asked for a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis shows that they are well qualified and are able to accept the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish Juana's store with the construction of a room to store merchandise

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta C.  vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Prudencio Jiménez y sus tres hijos.
La señora Benedicta trabaja como educadora en un Centro Comunal de su zona y su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de papel de la ciudad de El Alto adyacente a nuestra ciudad. 
El crédito es para la realización de piso de cemento en la habitación que ocupa ya que la misma solo tiene piso de tierra.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito
texts.en:
Señora Benedicta C. lives in the home of her parents in the zone called Llojeta, on the west side of the city of La Paz, with her husband, Señor Prudencio Jiménez, and their three children. Señora Benedicta works as an educator in the Community Center of the zone, and her husband works in a paper factory in the city of El Alto, adjacent to their own city. The loan is to make a cement floor in the home they occupy that currently only has an earthen floor. This is the second time that she has asked for a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis shows that she is well qualified and able to accept the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a cement floor for Benedicta's home

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El señor Basilio M. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado desde hace mucho tiempo con la señora Santa Lopez y viven en su casa propia, que esta situada en el Barrio Santa Rosa Guaviyu de San Juan del Parana. Ellos tienen tres hijos pequeños que aun dependen economicamente de los padres.

El señor Basilio junto con su esposa se dedican desde hace tiempo a la fabricacion de remeras para los estudiantes de los colegios de la zona y tambien para distribuir a vendedores ambulantes y comercios de la ciudad de Encarnacion. Gracias a este trabajo ellos pueden mantener su hogar y cubrir todas las necesidades que en el se presenten.

Ellos hoy dia estan solicitando el credito para la compra de una Maquina Collareta que les resulta necesario para mejorar la terminacion de sus prendas, ya que esta levantando mas pedidos de otras Escuelas y necesita tener los elementos necesarios. El monto que solicitan es de Gs. 2.000.000.
texts.en:
Mr. Basilio M. is 40 years old and has been married to Mrs. Santa Lopez for a long time. They live in their own home in the Santa Rosa Guaviyu neighborhood of San Juan de Parana. They have three small children who they still support financially. Basilio and his wife have been making t-shirts for some time now; they distribute the shirts to local schoolchildren, traveling salespeople and businesses in the city of Encarnacion. Thanks to this work, the couple is able to support their family and pay for any needs that arise. The couple is requesting this loan to buy a sewing machine so that they can do a better job finishing each item. They are receiving more and more T-shirt orders from other schools, so they need to have all the necessary implements to work with. They are requesting a loan of 2,000,000 guaraníes (US$400).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Cotahuma, zona periférica de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus hijos ya que su esposa se encuentra en España, pues se tuvo que ausentar por trabajo.
El señor Sergio es rentista de la municipalidad de La Paz y su esposa le envía dinero para manutención de la familia.
Con anteriores créditos realizo la construcción de parte de su vivienda, la misma que actualmente esta ocupando. 
El crédito es para la construcción de gradas para el segundo nivel de su casa.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Sergio A. lives in his own home, in the zone called Cotahuma, a zone peripheral to the city of La Paz, with just his children since his wife is away in Spain, where she had to go for work. Señor Sergio works for the city of La Paz, and his wife sends him money to support the family. With previous loans he has finished the construction of part of his home, the part that is currently occupied. This loan is for the construction of steps for the second level of his house. This is the third loan that he has asked for and the socioeconomic analysis shows that he is well qualified and is able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to complete his home

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Bajo Llojeta, ladera suroeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su  hija pues sufrió el abandono de su esposa.
El señor Dionisio es rentista de la policía de esta ciudad.
Con créditos anteriores construyó dos habitaciones en la vivienda que actualmente ocupan.
El crédito es para la construcción de un muro de contención que necesita su vivienda para la estabilización de su predio.
Esta es la novena vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Dionisio C. lives in his own home, in the zone called Bajo Llojeta, on the southwest side of the city La Paz, with his daughter as he has suffered the abandonment of his wife. Señor Dionisio works for the police of this city. With previous loans, he has constructed two rooms in the home that he currently occupies. This loan is for the construction of a retaining wall that his house needs to stabilise it. This is the ninth time he has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis shows he is well qualified and is able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a retaining wall to stabilise the land surrounding Dionicio's home

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El solicitante es el Sr. Hugo L.. El mismo es casado y posee cas propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Es casado y tiene 2 hijos que van al colegio de su Barrio Ita Paso. Hugo es microempresario se es prestador de servicios de profesion Maestro constructor de obras. Cuenta con 24 años de de antigüedad en el rubro. Cabe destacar que el mismo opera unicamente con Fundacion Paraguaya desde el 2006 con varias operaciones completas. El miimso solicito la suma de 2,500,000 a 12 meses para compras de herremientas para su actividad comercial para poder prestar mejor servicos a alas constructoras.
texts.en:
Hugo L. is married and has his own house with all the necessary home amenities. He has two children that attend the school in his neighborhood, Barrio Ita Paso. Hugo is a microentrepreneur, and his profession is master works builder. He has 24 years of experience in this field. He has only worked with Fundacion Paraguaya since 2006, and has finished various projects. He is seeking 2,500,000 PYG ($500) over 12 months to purchase tools for his economic activity to be able to provide better services to other builders.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Susana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario tiene su domicilio en la comarca de Pacayita, del municipio de Masaya, los tres se dedican a la misma actividad de elaboración y venta de muebles,sus talleres están ubicados en los patios de sus casas y venden en los mercados del país, generalmente tienen clientes fijos que se llevan toda la producción, ellos compran los materiales juntos para que estos les salgan más baratos. Son muy unidos, solidarios y de buenas recomendaciones.


Doña Susana es artesana en madera desde muy joven, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres. Es madre soltera de dos niños de 4 y 6 años, esto le ha instado a salir adelante para lograr darles educación y sus manutención; trabaja con su hermano menor que también es soltero y se han organizado para manejar el negocio, tiene 4 trabajadores y las máquinas son de ella, tiene casa propia que poco a poco ha ido construyendo. Los productos que elaboran son puertas, juegos de muebles, mesas y comedores, en muchos casos los encargos son un poco extraños pero se aprenden a elaborarlos.
Espera seguir creciendo con Adim, se siente muy satisfecha de poder trabajar por sí sola y haber obtenido créditos en base a la confianza.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is located in the region of Pacayita in the Masaya municipality. The three members all work making and selling furniture. Their workshops are located in their home patios and they sell in the country markets. Generally, they have fixed customers who buy all of their products. They buy their materials together to get them cheaper. They are very united and have good recommendations. Susana has been a wood craftswoman since she was very young; she learned this activity from her parents. She is a single mother with a four-year-old and a six-year-old, which is what drives her to succeed so she can give them an education and provide for them. She works with her younger brother who is also single, and they have organized themselves to manage the business. They have four workers, and Susana owns the machinery. She has her own house, which she has been building little by little. The products they make are doors, furniture sets, tables and dining tables. In many cases, the orders are strange, but they learn to make them. She hopes to keep growing with Adim; she is very satisfied that she is able to work for herself and to have obtained credit based on trust.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lodia

texts.es:
La solicitante es la Sra Lodia C. de Arias. La misma es microenepresaria. Ella esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, y posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar. Lodia se dedica a la venta de ropas, calazados, bijuteri y otras mercaderias. Ella va casa por casa para vender a despensas y otros clientes. Ella recorre los barrios como San Pedro, San Juan , San Miguel Arroyo Pora y otros.

Cuenta con 10 años trabajando el rubro. Lo que ella permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos. Solicito la suma de 2,000,000 Gs a 12 meses para compra de mercaderias como ser articulos escolares como estamos en la epocas de inicios de clases.
texts.en:
Lodia C. de Arias is a microentrepreneur. She is married, has two children, and has her own house with all the necessary amenities. Lodia sells clothing, footwear, jewelry and other merchandise. She goes house to house selling to customers. She travels neighborhoods like San Pedro, San Juan, San Miguel Arroya Pora and others. She has worked in this field for 10 years, and has a good clientele and income. She is seeking a loan for 2,000,000 PYG ($400) over 12 months to purchase merchandise like school supplies, as the school year is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, including school supplies

loans.name: Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Cascada, a éste pertenece la asociación Amor de Dios, grupo muy alegre, simpático y unido sobre todo.
La asociación Amor de Dios tiene diferentes actividades por ejemplo Felicidad tiene un puesto de dulces y otras golosinas, además también  venden frutas de la temporada, otras de ellas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de comida. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para abastecerse de mayores productos con el fin de ampliar sus ventas, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que apoyen a la economía de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Amor de Dios association is from Cascada in the city of El Alto. It’s a group that is very happy, friendly and, above all, united.

The Amor de Dios association has different types of work. For example, Felicidad has a candy stall and also sells seasonal fruit. Others work in the production of food. They need capital to stock up on more products in order to increase their sales. In this way, they can generate more income for their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a better quantity of products

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual D. has 1 child and received schooling through junior high school. Perpetual sells rice and cooking oil in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. Perpetual uses her income to pay for financial matters such as utilities and food. Perpetual will use the loan to expand the business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Perpetual plans to buy her own land.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Sindulfa

texts.es:
La señora Sindulfa R. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en pareja desde hace tiempo y tiene niños pequeños que aun dependen economicamente de los padres. Ellos viven en su casa propia que esta situada en el Barrio San Pedro Curupayty de la ciudad de Encarnacion desde hace varios años. 

La señora Sindulfa se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de Bolsitas de polietileno manera ambulante. Cuenta con una buena clientela que son las despensas y kioskos de diversos lugares y que siempre compra su mercaderia. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. 

Ella es cliente de la Fundacion desde hace tiempo y hoy dia esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mas Bolsitas de polietileno, ya que esta teniendo muchos pedidos por parte de su clientela y ademas quiere incrementar su actividad comercial adquiriendo otros tipos de mercaderias. El monto que solicita es de Gs. 3.000.000.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sindulfa R. is 39 years old, she has lived with her partner for some time and they have young children who they support. For several years they have lived in their own house which is located in the Barrio San Pedro Curupayty in the city of Encarnacion. Sindulfa has worked for some time now as a travelling salespersons offering plastic shopping bags. She counts on a good clientele composed of various shops and kiosks who always buy her merchandise. Through this work she is able to support her family and cover all household expenses. She has been a long time client of the foundation and today she is requesting a loan to buy more plastic shopping bags, since she has many orders from her customers. She also wants to diversify her business by acquiring other types of goods. The amount requested is of Gs. 3.000.000.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic shopping bags and other merchandise such as clothing for adults and children.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama A. sells various provisions in Cape Coast. She is married with 2 children and has received no formal education. Her husband is employed as a trader. Mama has been selling various provisions since 1999, and is responsible for paying for the utilities and food. Her loan will be used to purchase more goods in order to fill the store, which will increase capital. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase land.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to fill the store, which will increase capital.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is a very experienced carpenter. Since childhood he has had a desire to become a painter or a carpenter because he had the gift of being able to paint  beautifully and create different beautiful sculptures. He decided to follow the path of his father, who was also a carpenter. Now that he has all the necessary tools to work, Vadim can make wooden furniture like doors, windows, kitchens, beds, armchairs, and many other beautiful things.

Vadim wants to start a business in the sphere of manufacturing articles of wood. To do this, he will have to purchase some materials for his workshop. First, he would like to invest some money in advertising, and this will require the creation of booklets listing his name and what services he can provide.

And only after he has completed that, he will be able to start working according to the customers' demands.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Sembradoras” trabaja junto a la familia D. Pro-Mujer hace un año y medio aproximadamente. Pertenece al centro focal Cascada ubicado en la  urbanización 6 D. junio D. la ciudad D. El Alto.
Distintos son los negocios que este grupo tiene, algunas se dedican al tejido D. mantas, otras venden medias, galletas, dulces, ropa para niños Y otros. Necesitan D. mayores créditos  parea adquirir productos al por mayor, así las ganancias serias mayores, D. esta forma generar mas ingresos para lograr sostenibilidad económica en sus hogares
texts.en:
“Sembradoras” association has worked jointly with Pro-Mujer family for approximately a year and a half. It belongs to Cascada center, located in 6 D. junio district in El Alto city.

This group has several businesses developing; some women dedicate to blanket knitting, some others sell stockings, cookies, candies, children apparel, among other goods.

They need higher credits to purchase wholesale and obtain higher profits that can generate them more earnings to achieve their homes’ sustainability.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need to buy wholesale

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanahuapa Group

texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Yanahuapa Village Bank is a newly formed group, and is just beginning its first loan cycle with Asociacion Arariwa. The group members are all neighbors from Yanahuapa, a small town about fifteen minutes outside of the city of Urubamba, in the Sacred Valley. Though this is Santa Rosa de Yanahuapa's first loan from Arariwa, many of the group members have previously participated in group loans, either through Arariwa or through other local financial institutions. 

At the group's inauguration on March 26th, there was a warm, friendly atmosphere. After singing Peru's national anthem, the group members ate a celebratory inaugural meal of chicken, baked potatoes, corn and cheese in a spicy cilantro sauce, joking and laughing together all the while. The group's loan officer, Alfredo López, told the group that the seed capital they are receiving now may seem like very little, but soon their investments will bear fruit, and that single seed will produce 200, 500, or even 1000 seeds. 

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: they work as artisans, raising livestock or small animals like guinea pigs, growing grains, vegetables and flowers, as grocery store owners, and making and selling chicha, a traditional Andean alcoholic drink made from fermented corn. 

The group's president, Juan Gualberto A. G., teaches at the local school and also buys and sells cattle as an extra source of income. He currently has three Brown Swiss cows, and is feeding them so that he can sell them for a higher price. He plans to use his loan to buy seed to plant more grass for his cattle. This is Gualberto's first group loan, and he hopes to lead the group well in order to help its members get ahead in life and expand their businesses. "This organization depends on all of us working well," he told the group. He reminded them that everyone must attend all of the group's meetings, make payments on time, be punctual and responsible, and show solidarity with the other group members. 

The Santa Rosa de Yanahuapa group has agreed to work according to these principles and to repay their Kiva loan in full and on time. 

Note: Three people in the photo are not group members. The group's loan officer, Alfredo, is pictured sitting on the floor in front of the group. Emperatriz, one of Arariwa's Village Bank Supervisors, is pictured on the far left of the front row. The wife of the group's Secretary is pictured in the back row, third from right.

loans.use: Various, including seed to grow grass for cattle

loans.name: Omorotionwan

texts.en: Omorotionwan is a mechanic. He also sells motor spare parts and second hand cars. He lives in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. He hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He is 39 years old and married without children. He says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Haydee Soledad,

texts.es:
La librería bazar que en hoy día la ayuda a mantener su hogar trabajando todos los días, lo tiene desde hace siete años a raíz de que una amiga negoció con ella el traslado del negocio como propiedad de Haydee, puesto que implementaría un negocio nuevo.

Durante tres años, Haydee vendía anteriormente golosinas como ambulante. Pero sus aspiraciones siempre han ido creciendo. Actualmente a demás de su tienda en el mercado también alquila cuartos en su casa. Gracias a ello puede cubrir los gastos de su casa, como luz y agua. Los ingresos de su librería es para sus dos hijos de veinte y trece años.

Por otro lado, recibe todo el apoyo de su esposo, con quien más adelante quisiera comprar un carro para ofrecer servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
The bookstore bazaar today helps support her home. She works every day, and has had this business for 7 years, beginning the business with a friend and Haydee took over the business as her friend started a new business. For three years Haydee was selling snacks as a street vendor. But her aspirations have always been growing. Today in addition to her store in the market she rents rooms in her home. Thankfully she can cover her household expenses, such as electricity and water. The income from her store is for her two children ages 20 and 13 years old. She also receives the support of her husband, and in the future she and her husband would like to buy a car and offer taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo Solís Pérez tiene la edad de 55 años,  habita en el barrio Esquípula, junto a su esposa doña Martha la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene  dos hijos una de 29 años ya es casada y otra de 18 años que actualmente estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que ellos se han sacrificado mucho para poder salir hacia delante con sus cultivos , don William se dedica a la agricultura desde hace cinco años , pero a la vez trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada tres veces por semana desde hace ocho años , donde el trabaja casi son vecinos . La mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado durante su cultivo es la falta de financiamiento y por ello que el cultivo esta un poco maltratado, pero con la ayuda técnica de nuestro agrónomo puede salir hacia delante. El financiamiento es para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Señor Wilfredo Solís is 55 years old. He lives in the neighbourhood Esquípula, along with his wife Doña Martha who works as a commercial woman in the market in order to help with the expenses of the household. They have two children, a daughter of 29 years and another daughter of 18 years who is currently studying. The plans of the family are to better their conditions of life as they have already sacrificed a lot to move ahead with their cultivations. Don Wilfredo has been dedicated to agriculture for the past 5 years, but at times he works as a security guard in a private house three times per week, and has done so for the past 8 years, where he works almost with his neighbours. The biggest difficulty that has presented itself during their cultivation is the lack of financing, and because of this the farm is a little rundown, but with the technical help of our agronomist it will be able to improve. The financing is for the purchase of materials and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming materials

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Abraham has a viewing and games centre in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes to expand this business. He needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more games and televisions. He is 22 years old and single. He hopes to make more profit from this business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more games and televisions

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en: Felicity B. is single and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Felicity sells fried yams and chicken in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2007.  Felicity uses her income to pay for utilities, food, and other necessary items. Felicity will use the loan to purchase more goods in order to expand the business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Felicity plans to buy land.

loans.use: purchase more goods in order to expand the business

loans.name: Dora Luz,

texts.es:
Dora es una de los clientes más responsables y antiguas de su grupo de microcrédito. Ella estudiaba la carrera técnica de cosmetología y también de docencia en educación primaria, no obstante, sus estudios se vieron truncos a raíz de que tuvo a sus hijos, que hoy en día ya tiene dieciocho y once años.   

Con la idea de apoyar en los gatos del hogar y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos decidió dedicarse a trabajar. Por un tiempo estuvo trabajando para otra persona en una tienda de abarrotes, Luego decidió comprar su propio puesto en el mercado. Es así que desde hace siete años, vende abarrotes, pero además, también genera ingresos extras con la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo.

Más adelante, ella quisiera retomar sus estudios para poder ser una mejor empresaria y agrandar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Dora is one of the most responsible and oldest members of her microfinancing group. She studied cosmetology and also elementary education. Nevertheless her studies ended when she had children, who today are 18 and 11 years old. With the idea of supporting the household expenses and provide a better education to her children, she decided to work. For some time she worked for another person in a grocery store. Then she decided to buy her own stand in the market. So for 7 years she has been selling groceries and in addition she generated extra income by selling beauty products via catalog. In the future she would like to return to her studies to be a better businesswoman and expand her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and uniform for her younger child

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.en:
Since she was very young, Marta has worked alongside her family in the production of candles. In addition she makes and sells clothes such as güipiles (traditional Guatemalan weavings) with specific designs from the area of San Pedro. 

She originally started making and selling candles in San Pedro, where she lives, but then began to sell them in nearby towns like Chimaltenango, Pachalum, and San Antonio Aguas Calientes. When she has time, she always weaves at home. 

As her business has grown, Marta sees the potential that more capital can offer. In spite of the economic situation, she has continued working hard and struggling, although her candle workshop still lacks many things. With her loan she will invest in purchasing materials such as wax, the basic material used to make the candles. 

In addition, the cost of the thread that she uses to make the güipiles has risen. She would like to use part of her loan to purchase thread in bulk so that she has enough materials to meet the demands of her clients who continue to place orders. Her goal is to continue moving forward so that she can provide for her children and improve their situation day by day. 

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow


Doña Marta desde muy pequeña junto a su familia se dedican a la elaboración de candelas y veladoras también a la venta y elaboración de tejidos como güipiles San Pedranos. El tejido siempre lo hace en casa. El negocio elaborar y vender las candelas lo inicio en el pueblo de San Pedro donde ella vive, pero luego empezó en otros pueblos como Chimaltenango, Pachalum, y San Antonio Aguas Calientes. Por tal motivo ve la necesidad de mas capital, a pesar de la situación económica siguen luchando pero faltan muchas cosas aun para invertir en el taller donde fabrican las candelas y veladores, necesita mas capital para comprar parafina que es el material básico para las candelas. También el hilo para los güipiles ha subido por tal motivo desea comprar mas ya que siempre sus manos no han descansado en hacerlos ya que tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos a quienes entrega lo que piden. Su meta es salir adelante para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y que pueda mejorar cada día.

loans.use: Materials for candle-making and weaving

loans.name: Sugey

texts.es: La señora Sugey López R. tiene la edad de 31 años habita en el barrio Dennis Larios , junto a su esposo Rigoberto él cual trabaja como vendedor de Ocal , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos una niña de seis años que estudia su primaria , y un bebé de dos añitos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y garantizarle sus estudios , doña Sugey trabaja como secretaria en Enacal desde hace nueve años y como agricultura tiene once años , la mayor dificultad que se le presento es por falta de financiamiento ya que eso ocasiono que  gran parte del cultivo se perdió  ahora ella quiere establecer una manzana de piña y poder tener mejores ingresos , la señora inicio la actividad agrícola ya que sus padres se dedicaban a trabajar las tierras . Doña Sugey quiere el préstamo para establecer una manzana de piña para ellos requiere de muchos insumos agrícolas para tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Sugey López R. is 31 years-old and lives in the neighborhood Dennis Larios. She lives with her husband, Rigoberto, who works as an Ocal salesman to help her with home expenses. They have under their supervision two children, a 6 year-old daughter that is in elementary school and a 2 year-old baby. Their plans for the family are to improve their living conditions and to guarantee their studies. Sugey has worked as a secretary at Enacal for 9 years and as a farmer for 11 years. The biggest difficulty that has arisen for her is lack of financing, and this has caused her to lose a large part of the crop. Now she wants to establish a plot of pineapple and to be able to increase her income. She began this agricultural activity since her parents were dedicated to working the land. Sugey would like a loan to establish a plot of pineapple, which requires many agricultural supplies to have a good production.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the necessary agricultural supplies to establish a plot of pineapple

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells traditional beads. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more traditional beads to sell. She is 60 years old and married with 7 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more traditional beads to sell

loans.name: Elba Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Elba , es originario de la comarca Las F. perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental ubicado en la capital, ellas compran las cosechas en las comarcas vecinas y sacan el producto al mercado..
Se decidieron trabajar con Adim porque les gusta que les enseñen a manejar un crédito y otras cosas como el control contable de los ingresos de sus negocios y a ser dueñas de sus negocios. Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.

Doña Keyla María es una joven mujer de 25 años madre de tres hijo pequeños de 7,5 y 2 años , su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar él trabaja como artesano en un taller de Masaya. Ella vende frutas y verduras, pero además vende pan que es un producto que ofrece a sus clientes y le ha dado resultado, ella expresa que con el crédito ha podido diversificar los productos y así tener mejores ventas. Tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y ahorrar para eventualidades y así no tocar los ingresos del negocio.
texts.en:
The supportive group Elba is from the area of Las F. in the city of Masaya and in general the members dedicate themselves to the sale of fruits and vegetables in a market situated in the east of the capital. They purchase items harvested in the neighboring region and take them to market. They decided to work with Adim because they are taught how to manage a loan and other things such as financial accounting of their income and how to be owners of their businesses. This group pays on Mondays which they consider the best day to pay because their sales are best during the weekend. Mrs. Keyla María is a young woman of 25 years and a mother of three small children ages 7, 5, and 2. Her husband helps with the household expenses by working as an artisan in a workshop in Masaya. She sells fruits and vegetables, and also sells bread which is a product she offers her customers and which has given results. She tells us that the loans have enabled her to diversify her offerings and thereby have better income. Her goal is to grow her business and save for contingencies and therefore she doesn’t touch the income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the conditions of her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a policeman. She sells sarongs wholesale and retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maria Izabel

texts.en:
For Isabel P., her work of making traditional weavings was a gift from her mother who taught her everything about the craft. She began her business by selling traditional napkins in the market in San Juan Sacatepéquez. Over time the demand from her customers grew larger and she saw the need for more capital in order to buy spools of thread.

Today she not only makes napkins, but also cloths used to carry babies, tablecloths, and scarves. Isabel feels the effects of the economic situation, but is happy that her customers continue to place orders. She says that the cost of thread has risen and that she needs more capital to purchase the necessary materials for her work.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to meet customer demand and to continue making sales and growing her business. Her dream is to have a big store in the market that sells all different types of weavings. She will continue struggling and pushing forward to provide for her family just as she has always done.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow

Para Doña Isabel la elaboración de tejidos a la que se dedica ha sido el regalo de su madre ya que fue ella quien le enseñó este oficio. Inicia con servilletas típicas, vendiendo en el mercado de San Juan Sacatepéquez. Con el tiempo los pedidos fueron creciendo y ve la necesidad de mas capital para la compra de conos de hilos. Elabora hoy en día no solo servilletas, también herrajes, manteles, chalinas, cargadores típicos. La situación económica esta dura pero sus clientes continúan haciendo pedidos. El hilo ha subido ya cada vez es mas el capital que necesita. Por tal motivo solicita su crédito ya que hay demanda de clientes y desea aprovechar y seguir vendiendo y creciendo en su negocio. Su sueño es tener local grande con todo tipo de tejidos en el mercado y seguir luchando por su familia como siempre lo ha hecho.

loans.use: Materials for traditional weavings

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipe surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de comidas, almacen, peluqueria, despensa, confeccion de cortinados, venta de frutas y verduras , venta de ropas v, venta de cosmeticos . El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000 a 1.200.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente. 

1.	Apolonia Quiñonez Paiva - Venta de Ropas
2.	María Lourdes F. - Peluquería y Cantina
3.	Mariela Peña - Venta de comestibles 
4.	Gladys P. -Almacen 
5.	Nancy González -Despensa
6.	Mercedes Báez -Kiosko
7.	Lidia V. de León -Venta de comestibles
8.	María Perla Y. -Modista
9.	Antonia Báez Ibarra -Cotillón
10.	María Angelica A. -Almacen
11.	Lisandra Morínigo - Venta de Cubiertos
12.	Griselda Fernández -Venta de Comestibles 
13.	Idalia Monzón -Venta de frutas y verduras
14.	Gertrudis León González - Venta de Ropas
15.	Dalmin Nuñez - Venta de Cosmeticos
16.	Cristel Y. López - Cortinados
17.	María Fátima A. - Venta de Ropas
texts.en:
The Chaipe del Barrio group came into being through one of the partners of the foundation. All the women work productively which include: food sales, store owners, hairdressers, pantries, curtain making, fruit and vegetable sales, clothing sales, and cosmetic sales. The amount each woman receives varies from 300,000 to 1,200,000, all the women will apply their loans to the work they are already undertaking. 1. Apolonia Quiñonez Paiva – Clothing sales 2. María Lourdes F. – Hairdresser and bartender 3. Mariela Peña – Food sales 4. Gladys P. – Grocery store 5. Nancy González – Pantry 6. Mercedes Báez – Kiosk 7. Lidia V. de León – Food sales 8. María Perla Y. – Dressmaker 9. Antonia Báez Ibarra – Dance hall 10. María Angelica A. – Grocery store 11. Lisandra Morínigo – Cutlery sales 12. Griselda Fernández – Food sales 13. Idalia Monzón – Fruit and vegetable sales 14. Gertrudis León González – Clothing sales 15. Dalmin Nuñez – Cosmetic sales 16. Cristel Y. López – Curtain making 17. María Fátima A. – Clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, food items for kiosks and pantries, such as flour, oil, noodles, cigarettes, tea, beverages, meat, cutlery, fabrics, cosmetics and hairdressing

loans.name: Italo Fernando,

texts.es:
Ítalo es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos planes para el futuro. Actualmente y desde hace trece años se dedica a vender panes por las mañanas y por las tardes. Esta venta lo hace casa por casa y bajo pedidos. Por otro lado, también cuenta con un puesto propio en el mercado de su localidad. Hace más de diez años pensó en invertir su dinero en un negocio más estable, por lo que decidió comprar un puesto en el mercado de su localidad. Poco a poco fue llenado aquel puesto con mercadería. Hoy además de vender pan por la mañana y tarde atiende en su tienda de abarrotes.

Como si fuera poco, Ítalo también atiende solicitudes de trabajo eventuales como el pintado de paredes u obras de construcción. A sus treinta y nueve años, él desea estudiar administración para poder tener una empresa más grande.
texts.en:
Italo is a hard-working person with many plans for the future. He has been selling bread in the mornings and afternoons for 3 years. These sales he does house to house and by orders. He also has his own stand in the market in his neighborhood. More than 10 years ago he thought about investing his money in a stable business, so he decided to buy the stand in the market. Little by little he filled it with merchandise. Today in addition to bread in the morning and afternoon he takes care of his grocery store. As if that were not enough, Italo also does odd jobs like painting walls or construction jobs. At 39 years old, he wishes to study business administration in order to be able to have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries and bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing sells cooked foods and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine sells clothes and sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She travels to Cotonou to purchase her clothes and sarongs to sell in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: El señor José de Jesús M. Dávila tiene la edad de 60 años habita en el reparto Juan Rapilla, junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las labores del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos dos están casado y un joven de 18 años que actualmente estudia, los planes hacia su familia es apoyar a su hijo para que estudie en la universidad, don José desde hace veinte año trabaja como agricultor la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento seguido de la mala producción y los robos que ha sufrido el cultivo , el inicio los trabajos agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos.
texts.en:
José de Jesús M. Dávila is 60 years-old and lives in the Juan Rapilla district. He lives with his wife, who supports him with the household labors. They have three children. Two are married and the youngest is 18 years-old and is currently studying. His plans for the family are to support his son so that he can go to college. José has worked as a farmer for 20 years. The biggest difficulty for him is lack of financing following a bad crop and the robberies that the crop has suffered. José started his agricultural work with his own efforts. He would like financing to buy fertilizers and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supplies to improve his crop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La cliente se llama Maria Zara S. de 44 años. Vive con el Señor Luis Meireles de 51 años de edad que es su marido que se encuentran casados hace mas de 25 años.  Ellos poseen dos hijos en la cuales ya son mayores de edad y cada uno tiene su trabajo y se ayudan entre todos, pero aun viven con ellos, poseen casa propia en el Barrio Santa Rosa.

Cabe destacar que Maria es costurera hace mas de 22 años y es propietaria de un taller de costura ubicado en pleno centro de la ciudad. Cuenta con muchisimos clientes por que tiene excelente calidad de trabajo y realiza costura de ropa para Damas, Caballeros y Niños. Tiene cliente que trabaja con ella hace años. Cabe mencionar que su marido le ayuda en forma economica con los gastos de la casa por que trabaja como chofer particular.

El destino del credito de 2.500.000 es para la compra de una maquina de coser Overloc nueva para asi ir mejoranda la calidad de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Zara S. is 44 years old. She lives with her husband of more than 25 years, Mr. Luis Meireles who is 51 years of age. They have two children whom are of age and still live at home, each child has his/her own job and they all help each other; they own a house in Barrio Santa Rosa. It is noteworthy that Maria has been a seamstress for more than 22 years and owns a sewing workshop located in the heart of the city. She has many clients because of her excellent quality of work; she sews clothing for women, men and children. She has many clients whom she has worked with for years. Her husband contributes to household expenses by working as a private driver. The purpose of the 2,500,000 loan is to purchase a sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine to improve her quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine sells provisions and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all those who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Flor De Verano Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Flor de Verano , es originario de la comarca La Reforma perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, de forma general se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental ubicado en la capital, ellas compran las cosechas en las comarcas vecinas y sacan el producto al mercado..

Las tres miembros tienen mucha confianza entre ellas, son vecinas y se unen para la compra de algunos productos y así logran mejores precios.

Doña Juana Antonia M. es una mujer de 51 años de edad, muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y dos hijos ya jóvenes, los hijos ya trabajan por cuenta propia y su esposo le ayuda con los gastos porque trabaja en acarreos en Masaya, esta señora tiene  su activad económica que es la compra y venta de cosechas de frutas y verduras, según la temporada, la cual la vende en el mercado oriental ubicado en la ciudad de Managua.
Se propone pagar los créditos con mucha puntualidad y animar a las integrantes para salir adelante. Su meta es de mejorar su vivienda y dejarla como ella quiere, con comodidad para su vejez y ayudarle a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios.

Las integrantes expresan que han tenido buenas ganancias con los créditos obtenidos, estos los invierten en temporadas que saben que hay demanda y buen precio.

Este grupo abona los días Lunes porque, se considera que es el mejor día para abonar, esto porque las ventas del fin de semana son las mejores.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Verano” group is originally from the La Reforma area of Masaya city. Generally the members of this group sell fruit and vegetables in the eastern market in the capital. They buy the harvests in the neighboring regions and take the products to market. The three members have a lot of confidence. They are neighbors and have united to buy some products and in this way receive better prices. Juana Antonia M. is 51 years old, hard-working, and lives with her husband and two children who each work on their own and her husband who helps her with the household expenses as he works in transportation in Masaya. This woman buys and sells fruits and vegetables, depending on the season, and sells them in the eastern market in Managua city. She plans on paying the loan punctually and inspiring the members to continue forward toward success. Her goal is to improve her home and make it to be as she wants, comfortable for her old age and to help her children finish their studies. The members express that they have good earnings with the loans and they invest the earnings in seasons that they know there is demand and good prices. This group makes payments on Mondays because they consider it the best day to pay because the weekend sales are the best.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in improving their businesses

loans.name: Olga Iduvina,

texts.es:
Olga siempre ha trabajado en talleres de confección. Son embargo, la idea de independizarse nació a raíz de que tuvo a sus hijos. Por esta razón invertía sus sueldos en la compra de maquinas para implementar un taller de confección en su casa. Una vez que tuvo las máquinas necesarias abandonó su trabajo diario para terceras personas y abrió su taller. En solo tres años y gracias a su empeño y dedicación implemento su taller con mas maquinas, por lo que ahora confecciona ropa no solo a medida sino también al por mayor, es decir también realiza confección industrial.

Cuando tiene pedidos grandes, mayormente de colegios, solicita el servicio de otras personas para que trabajen con ella. Por otro lado, desde hace dos meses trabaja como control de calidad en una empresa textil.

Ella sueña con ser una empresaria exitosa en el futuro, aunque en parte ya lo es, y tener un taller de confección más amplio y mejor implementado. Ella es quien mantiene su hogar y a sus tres hijos de dieciséis, trece y ocho años, su esposo se encuentra en el exterior.
texts.en:
Olga has always worked as a seamstress in a shop. Nevertheless, the idea of having her own business was born when she had her children. So she invested her earnings in buying machines to open a seamstress shop in her home. Once she had the necessary machines she left her daily job and opened her shop. In only three years and thanks to her hard work and dedication she opened her own shop with more machines, so now she makes clothing not only to order but also at wholesale, in other words she now has an industrial operation. When she has large orders, primarily from schools, she seeks the service of others who will work for her. She also has been working as a quality control in a textile business for 2 months. She dreams of having a successful business in the future, even though part of it already is, and having a larger and better implemented clothing making shop. She is who supports her home and her three children ages 16, 13, and 8. Her husband is out of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells provisions and clothes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and clothes to sell. She is 48 years old and married with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and clothes to sell

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha F. sells provisions in Cape Coast. Agartha has received a junior high school education and she is married with 4 children Her husband is employed as a petty trader.  Agartha has been selling provisions since 2003. She is responsible for paying rent, utilities, food, and other necessary items. Her loan will be used to buy more goods in order to fill the store. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a building.

loans.use: to buy more goods in order to fill the store

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi Y. is married with 2 children and has received her education through secondary school. Naomi sells bags, materials, clothes, and other goods in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband works at an electric company. Naomi uses her income to pay for  rent, school, and utilities. Naomi will use the loan to buy more clothes and materials for the purpose of selling. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naomi plans to put up a building.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and materials for the purpose of selling

loans.name: Nora,

texts.es:
Con cincuenta y ocho años, Nora aun tiene muchos planes que desea cumplir en el futuro. Ella además D. ser una gran microempresaria, también es una madre ejemplar, pues solo con su trabajo se ha encargado D. cuidar a sus tres hijos ella sola. Ellos ya son mayores e independientes, gracias al esfuerzo D. Nora.

En uj inicio Nora ha sido docente D. educación inicial y primaria trabajando en colegios. Tiempo después se animo por tener un negocio propio, por lo que compro un puesto en el mercado. Hoy el negocio ya tiene ocho años, y lo que en un inicio era solo tienda D. abarrotes se ha convertido en un bazar, pues no solo venD. abarrotes, también bebidas y artículos varios.

Por otro lado, hace tres años decidió aprovechar su tiempo en casa también vendiendo gaseosas y cervezas por la tarD. y en la noche. Ahora lo que ella más quiere es tener un negocio  mucho más granD. y menos pesado para la edad que tiene. Quisiera abrir un restaurante o una librería en su casa.
texts.en:
At 58 years old, Nora still has many plans she hopes to fulfill in the future. Besides being a great small businesswoman, she's also an exemplary mother, since while working she took care of raising her 3 children by herself.
