They are now older and independent, thanks to Nora's efforts. In the beginning, Nora was an elementary school teacher working in schools. Later, she became excited about having her own business, so she bought a place in the market. Now her business has been going for 8 years, and what began as only a grocery store has become a bazaar. She not only sells groceries but also drinks and various goods. On the other hand, it's been 3 years since she decided to take advantage of her time at home by also selling sodas and beer in the afternoon and in the evening. Now, what she wants most is to have a bigger business that is less difficult for a woman her age. She wants to open a restaurant or a library at home.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: S. akoko  exerce depuis 1979 le commerce de « kluklu » qui est une sorte de galette faite à base de maïs et d’huile, cette galette est très appréciée au Togo surtout dans la partie septentrionale du Togo, son stock de maïs nécessaires à la fabrication de cette galette est épuisé, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 06 sacs de maïs et 04 bidons d’huile. Elle est mariée avec un militaire qui est à la retraite, ils ont 07 personnes à leurs charges et avec le bénéfice de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer
texts.en:
Since 1979, S. Akoko has been making and selling "kluklu", a galette made out of corn and oil and very much appreciated in Togo, especially in the South. She's out of stock of corn, which is why she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, to buy 6 sacks of corn and 4 cans of oil. She's married to a retired soldier, and they have 7 children to support. With the profits of her business, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 sacks of corn and 4 cans of oil

loans.name: El Faisan Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo solidario El Faisán , son originarias de la Ciudad de Masaya, viven en el Barrio Monimbó, ellas se decidieron a trabajar con Adim porque escucharon en la promoción que era para mujeres pobres con negocios pequeños.

Doña Lourdes  del Socorro es la coordinadora del grupo, una joven mujer de 33 años, casada, madre de una hija de nueve años que estudia  la primaria en una escuela cercana al mercado, después de sus clases le ayuda a ella en el negocio.Su negocio es venta de productos perecederos en el mercado Municipal en el sector de leñas, en la periferia del mercado, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la conoce de su madre que aún  vende en el mismo sector; los productos que ofrece son : lechugas, tomates, repollos, zanahorias, papas, etc. expresa que son los que tienen mayor movimiento en su inventario.
Compra en el mismo mercado en el sector mayorista, estos productos los compra asociadas con las del grupo y así consiguen rebajas en los precios. Su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 3 a.m. y termina a las 3 p.m. Tiene casa propia hasta hace un año, esta la terminó acondicionar hace unos meses.
Su esposo es comerciante del mercado pero, de productos como sandía, melón y plátanos, hace unos años vendían juntos ahora ella se independizó porque así ella puede comprar lo que decida de sus ganancias. Él le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y de estudio de la hija, ella maneja su propio dinero, siente que esto ha mejorado su condición como persona y económicamente, tiene más derechos en el hogar. Expresa que en Adim le enseñaron el valor de su trabajo y que su negocio es de ella así como sus logros.
Todo lo anterior hace que anime a sus compañeras a ser muy cumplidas con el pago.
texts.en:
This is the solidarity group El Faisán. They are all from the city of Masaya and live in the Monimbó neighborhood. They decided to work with Adim because they heard the promotion for poor women with small businesses. Doña Lourdes del Socorro is the coordinator of the group. She's a young woman, age 33, married and the mother of a nine year old daughter in elementary school near the market. After her classes, the daughter helps her mother with her business. Her business is the sale of perishable goods in the municipal market in the firewood market on the outskirts of the market. For many years, she's dedicated herself to this activity. She's known for her association with her mother who sells in the same sector. The products that she offers include: lettuce, tomatoes, cabbage, carrots, potatoes, etc. (these are the ones that have the most movement en her inventory). She buys in the same market in the wholesale sector. She buys these products with the other women of her group and in this way she gets the reductions in price. Her workday begins at 3 am and ends at 3pm. She has had her own house for a year which she just finished setting up a few months ago. Her husband is a market trader but of products like watermelon, melon and bananas. For some years now, they have sold their products together. Now she is becoming independent because this way she can buy what she wants with her profit. He helps her with the house expenses and their daughter's schooling expenses. She manages her own money and feels she has improved her condition as a person and economically, while having more rights at home. She says that in Adim, they have learned the value of work and that their business is hers, just like her accomplishments. All of this motivates her group-mates to fulfill their payment.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for business

loans.name: Cristina,

texts.es:
Cuando aun vivía en su antigua casa, Cristina se dedicaba a vender menús a los trabajadores de la fábrica de bebidas gasificadas con una marca reconocida. Como a esta fábrica le iba bien decidieron cambiar de lugar para ampliarla. Razón por la que los trabajadores también se mudaron y con ello, Cristina perdió a sus principales clientes.

Un tiempo después ella también decidió mudarse de hogar. Con esta mudanza ella vio una fuente de ingresos si se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su localidad. Es por esto que compro ya hace cuatro años su puesto y vende todos los días. Un año después de haber empezado ese negocio se pensó que seria bueno si aprovechaba también su tiempo por las tardes, pues a veces el negocio de las verduras no era suficiente. Por ello todas las tardes vende en el paradero principal de su casa, anticuchos, pollo a la parrilla, entre otros platos.

Ella ha sido madre soltera de tres hijos que hoy tienen veinte, dieciocho y dieciséis años. Por quienes siempre esta en constante busca de otro negocio que pueda ser mas rentable. Por ahora, solo desea aumentar la mercadería de su puesto de verduras.
texts.en:
When she was still living in her old house, Cristina dedicated her time to selling menus to the workers at the soda factory with a well-known label. They decided to move the factory to expand it. Because of this, the workers also moved and so Cristina lost her principal clients. Some time later, she also decided to move away from home. With this move, she saw a source of income if she dedicated herself to the sale of vegetables in the town market. Because of this, she bought her place four years ago and sells everyday. A year after beginning this business she thought it would be good if she also took advantage of her time in the afternoon since sometimes the vegetable business is not sufficient. Every afternoon she sells kebabs, grilled chicken, among other dishes, in the principal area near her house. She has been a single mother of 3 kids that are now 20, 18 and 16 years old. She's always constantly in search of a more profitable business. For now, she only hopes to increase her merchandise for her vegetable sales.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: A roof for a shop in the market

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama J. was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. She is a divorcee with two children to look after. Adama sells market food and has been in this business for over seven years now. Adama is very grateful to SMT  for the previous loans. Previous loans through SMT have created a meaningful impact in the business and life of Adama. 

Having repaid previous loan successfully, she is now requesting a new one in order to further strengthen her business. With this loan and the income it will generate for her, she will be able to repay the loan, feed herself and children, and pay school fees and other school-related charges for the children.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina S. is married with 4 children and has received schooling through Form 4. Selina sells groundnuts, rice, beans, and other provisions in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband works for the fire department. Selina uses her income to pay for rent, utilities, clothes, and other necessities. Selina will use the loan to purchase goods to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Selina plans to put up a building.

loans.use: purchase goods to expand the business

loans.name: Las Limonarias Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Las limonarias son originarias de la comarca Belén del municipio de Los Altos, Tisma, son personas conocidas por su actividad y honorabilidad, tienen diferentes ocupaciones. Doña María Teresa vende quesillos en el mercado de Masaya, doña Ivaqnia del Socorro vende ropa al crédito y doña María Esperanza vende frutas y perduras en el mercado de Masaya.
Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, están muy comprometidas en sus pagos para siempre tener créditos con Adim.

Doña Ivania es la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad,es comerciante ropa en su comunidad, la vende al crédito y sus clientes le hacen muchos encargos, compra en el mercado de Masaya  los días martes y jueves, los demás días vende en la comarca, aprovecha las tardes para hacer su trabajo ya que por la mañana atiende a sus dos hijos pequeños de 2 y 4 años.
Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos, es zapatero y trabaja en Masaya en un taller de calzado.
Inició su negocio para ser independiente con su dinero y comprar lo que cree conveniente, esto hizo que ella pudiera decidir en todo en el hogar, está muy contenta porque además comparte con sus compañeras otras actividades, ella inició la formación del grupo y como han engrandecido un poco sus negocios está muy satisfecha también por sus compañera que junto con ella clasificaron para obtener el crédito con Adim.
texts.en:
The members of the group Las limonarias are from the Belén region in the municipality of Los Altos, Tisma. They are people known for their activity and integrity and they all have different occupations. Doña María Teresa sells cheese in the market of Masaya, doña Ivaqnia del Socorro sells clothing on credit and doña María Esperanza sells fruits and vegetables in the market of Masaya. They are hard working women who are very engaged in their payments so they always have loans with Adim. Doña Ivania is the group coordinator. She is a young woman, age 25 who sells clothing in her community. She sells the clothing on credit and her clients make many orders, buying in the market of Masaya on Tuesdays and Thursdays. The other days she sells in the region, taking advantage of the afternoons to do her work and in the morning she cares for her two small sons, ages 2 and 4. Her husband helps her with the expenses. He is a shoemaker and works in Masaya in a footwear workshop. She began her business to be independent with her money and to buy what she thinks is advisable. This means that she is able to decide on everything in the home. She's very content because she shares with her group members other activities. She began the formation of the group and has seen how their businesses have improved a little. She's very satisfied also because her group has qualified for a loan with Adim.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for work

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is Isatu K., a local entrepreneur who sells laundry and bathing soap in Kabala, the northern Sierra Leone town where she was born. Isatu, 39, is the mother of three children, and because her husband is retired, she bears the entire burden of supporting the family. Isatu is requesting this loan to expand her business, generate more income and consequently improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es originario de un barrio de Masaya que se llama San Carlos, son vecinas y bien conocidas. Sus actividades son variadas doña María del Socorro L. tiene un pequeño taller de calzado donde producen sandalias de mujer, doña Karla Cecilia P. vende cosméticos ambulante en el mercado y en los barrios de Masaya y doña Lucelia del Socorro L. L.  vende también ropa y cosméticos.

Doña Karla Cecilia P. R. es una joven  de 29 años, madre de dos hijos de 17 y 15 años, estos los ha criado sola proveyendo los bienes del hogar, trabaja vendiendo cosméticos y ropa menor en los barrios de forma ambulante. Compra sus productos en el mercado de Masaya, vende solo por encargos de sus clientes para maximizar el capital de trabajo, con el crédito podrá invertir en otros productos y ofrecerlos.
Tiene casa propia, es de origen humilde, expresa que los créditos ha mejorado las ventas y sus ingresos, se propone hacer crecer su negocio y dar estudio a sus hijos, ellos le ayudan a entregar encargos.

Trabaja todo el día los lunes, miércoles, viernes y Sábado porque de mejor recuperación.
Anima a las integrantes del grupo para que sean puntual en los pagos y así obtener más créditos con Adim y así asistir a las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
This group is from the neighborhood of Masaya called San Carlos. The women of this group are neighbors and well known. Their activities are varied. Doña María del Socorro L. has a small shoe workshop where they produce women's sandals. Doña Karla Cecilia P. sells cosmetics, traveling in the market and in the neighborhoods of Masaya. Doña Lucelia del Socorro L. also sells clothes and cosmetics. Doña Karla Cecilia P. R. is a young woman, 29 years old. She's the mother of 2 children ages 17 and 15. She has raised them by herself, providing for the needs of her household. She sells cosmetics and clothing, traveling to other neighborhoods. She buys her products in the market of Masaya. She sells only through orders to maximize her working capital. With the credit she will be able to invest in other products and offer them to her clients. She has her own house. She's from humble origins. She says that the loans have improved her sales and her income. She intends to grow her business and provide schooling for her kids. They help her to turn in her orders. She works every Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. She motivates the members of the group so that they are punctual in their payments and therefore get more loans with Adim and attend the trainings.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the improvement of their businesses

loans.name: Sewa

texts.en:
Sewa Mansaray was born in Kabala. He is 47 and married with six children. Sewa is a lorry (truck) driver and has been in this profession for over 20 years now.

Sewa has accessed several loans from Kiva through SMT. With previous loans, Sewa was able to fix his vehicle, which had broken down for over nine months. With this loan, Sewa will buy spare parts to replace the worn-out ones in his vehicle.

loans.use: Buying spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Adams

texts.en: For the last eight years, Adams S. has made a living selling video and CD players in Kingsway near Cape Coast. Adams, who is a graduate of the local high school, is very committed to expand his business and increase his profits. He will use this loan to buy more goods to sell to his customers, and hopes to use the profits from his business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice H. makes a living selling cloth, rice, oil and food she prepares in the Anafo Market in Cape Coast. She has been in business for 25 years, has four children and is a graduate of the local junior high school.  Beatrice is very committed to pay her children's school fees, and will use this loan to increase her sales and expand in her food-production business. She hopes to use the new profits she earns to build a house.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: María De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora María de la Cruz C. es una joven mujer de 24 años madre de 2 niños pequeños, inició su negocio porque vio la necesidad de tener más ingresos para el hogar, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos pero a veces no alcanzaba, al ver esto decidió poner una pequeña pulpería y tener su propio ingreso.
Inició con un pequeño ahorro pero al ir creciendo la clientela le solicitaban más productos y se dispuso a solicitar un crédito para satisfacer a los clientes y observó que sus ventas se incrementaron y le quedó más ganancias.
Tiene como meta incrementar en clientes para crecer en sus ventas , esto lo conseguirá invirtiendo en la pulpería y aplicando los controles que le han enseñado en Adim, está muy segura de lograrlo si tiene un buen record crediticio y obtener préstamos mayores para incrementar inventario y mejorar el local.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de la Cruz C. is a young woman of 24 years and the mother of two small children. She started her business because she saw the need to have better income for her household. Her husband helps with the household expenses but sometimes it is not enough. Therefore, she decided to open a small grocery store and have her own income. She started small, but to increase her customer base she required more products and asked for a loan to satisfy her customers. She observed that her sales went up and resulted in more profit. She has the goal of increasing her customers in order to increase her sales, and to achieve this by investing in the grocery store and applying the business controls that are taught by Adim. She is very sure she will achieve her goal if she has a good credit record and obtains greater loans to increase her inventory and improve her location.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To offer a greater variety of products to her customers according to their requests

loans.name: Valeria,

texts.es:
Valeria tiene un taller de compostura y confección de ropa.. El taller tiene mas de veinte años, que lo ha implementado como una tienda de ropa, pues además de confeccionar ropa a medida también compra ropa ya hecha para venderla en su casa. Hoy en día la venta de ropa comprada le genera mayores ingresos, pues la competencia de los productos occidentales, que están mucho más baratos, hace que la gente prefiera comprar ropa ya hecha.

Ella empezó trabajando en una fábrica de jeanes de una marca reconocida. Este trabajo lo abandonó ya que se gano un terreno en el lugar donde vive actualmente. Para no perder el terreno debía mudarse a vivir ahí, de este modo su trabajo le quedaba muy lejos y decidió abrir su taller propio. Poco a poco ha ido cumpliendo sus metas. Una vez que obtuvo el terreno ha ido construyendo su casa poco a poco. Hoy ya tiene todo un primer nivel construido, así que Valeria esta pensando continuar construyendo un segundo nivel para poder implementar su taller con más máquinas.
texts.en:
Valeria has a repair and dressmaking shop. The shop, which is now more than 20 years old, began as a clothing shop. Along with dressmaking to measurements, she also buys already-made clothing to sell in her house. Nowadays, selling the purchased clothing generates the greatest income, since the competition from Western products, which are much cheaper, means that the people prefer to buy already made clothing. She began working in a jeans factory for a well-known label. She left this job when she got the plot of land in the place where she actually lives. In order to not lose the land, she had to move to live there. Because of this, her job was far away and she decided to open her own shop. Little by little she has accomplished her goals. Once she had the plot of land, she went about constructing her house little by little. Today she already has all of the first level finished, so now Valeria is thinking about constructing a second level to be able to put more machines in her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry K. is a widow with four children. Her husband was killed during the civil war in Sierra Leone that lasted for 10 years. When he died, Jerry began selling slippers to make a living. She needs a loan to expand her business. With the profit she makes, Jerry will be able to pay her bills on time and in full, feed herself and her family and pay school fees and other charges for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying dozens of pairs of slippers to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: For the last 15 years, Edward Y. has made a living second-hand shoes at UCC/Kingsway in Cape Coast. Edward is married, has four children and is a graduate of the local high school.  His wife is employed as a hairdresser.  His financial responsibilities include paying for his children's schooling. Edward has applied for a loan to expand his business selling second-hand shoes. He hopes to use the increased profits made possible by this loan to build a house.

loans.use: To expand his business selling second-hand shoes

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: For the last 10 years, Alex A. has made a living second-hand shoes at Kingsway in Cape Coast. He has a high-school degree, is a hard worker and is committed to pay all his bills on time. Alex will use this loan to expand his business, and hopes to use the increased profits made possible by this expansion to buy land and build a house on it.

loans.use: To expand his business selling second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Saffiatu

texts.en: This is Saffiatu K., who was born in Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age 34, married with three children. Saffiatu sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for over five years now. With this loan, Saffiatu will expand her business. She will buy two bales of second-hand clothes to add to her current stock. This will enable Saffiatu to make more profit, repay her loan, and consequently improve on her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase inventory.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene una refresquería, golosinas y venta de ropa, con cinco años de estar en las ventas, ella inició con fondos que sus hermanos le dieron, ya que ellos viven En los Ángeles, USA, lo cual ella invirtió en la compra de una mantenedora y vendía refrescos en el mercado oriental unos de los mas frecuentado por los Nicaragüenses, pero después de un tiempo trasladó el negocio a su casa de habitación. Tiene 55 años de edad, reside en el barrio La Fuente, sus hijas son independientes, su esposo se desempeña como técnico de reparación de electrodomésticos. Con este crédito va invertir en la compra de frutas, comprar el azúcar por quintal, gaseosas y otros productos que puedan sastifacer a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder agrandar el negocio y captar clientes para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
For five years Maria has had a small market stand where she sells soft drinks, sweets and clothing. She opened her shop with funds given to her by her brothers, who live in Los Angeles. She invested the money in the purchase of a market stand and since has sold soft drinks in the eastern market, which is one of the busiest markets in Nicaragua. After a while she moved the business to her home. Maria is 55 years old and lives in La Fuente. Her daughters are grown and her husband is employed as a household appliances repairman. She plans to use the loan to purchase fruits, sugar in bulk, soft drinks and other products her clients will like. She would like to expand the business and attract new clients to increase her revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, sugar, soft drinks and other products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. operates a grocery store and she sells tapioca, milk and sugar, in Cape Coast, She has done so since 2000.

She is married with two children and her husband is a mason. Elizabeth is responsible for paying school fees, food and utilities.

Her loan will be used to expand her trade in the groceries. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: Pay school fees and buy land.

loans.name: Alba Cristina

texts.es: Señora de 38 años de edad, cuenta con un pequeño taller de fabricación de cortes típicos, ubicado en el Paraje ChiP., del cantón Juchanep, Totonicapán, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia, ha logrado sobresalir en el negocio, ya que juntamente con la ayuda de su esposo quien tiene otra fuente de ingreso han logrado sostener a su familia, en la actualidad tiene demanda pero por falta de capital la señora Alba solicita a ala Asociación ASDIR, un préstamo para la compra de materia prima y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y con ello mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
She is a woman of 38 years of age, she has a small workshop manufacturing traditional clothing, located in Paraje Chiper, in the town of Juchanep, Totonicapán. She has 15 years of experience, has managed to excel in her business with the help of her husband, who has another source of income, and both have managed to support their family. She has a demand for merchandise but due to a lack of capital, Mrs. Alba is asking the ASDIR Association for a loan to purchase premium fabric, and be able to fill orders for her customers thereby improving the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (increase capital)

loans.name: Teresa Vicenta

texts.es: La señora Teresa Y., casada de 43 años de edad, se dedica a le venta ropa típica, en el municipio de San Francisco el Alto, San Cristóbal y Totonicapán, debido a la demanda que tiene, es necesario de ampliar su capital,  por lo que solicita a la Asociación ASDIR un crédito para la compra de mas ropas típicas ya que con ello podrá comerciar mas productos y tendrá surtido el negocio. La cual la persona podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa Y., is married and is 43 years old. She sells traditional clothing in the municipality of San Francisco el Alto, San Cristóbal and Totonicapán. Due to the demand, it is necessary to increase her capital, for that reason she is requesting a loan from the ASDIR Association to buy more traditional clothing since she can trade it for more products and have a variety of merchandise for her business. She will be able to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce (increase capital)

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah O. sells materials, such as cloth at Gari Moree market, near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2001.

She is married with two children and has received schooling through senior high school. Dinah’s husband is employed as a driver.

Dinah uses her income to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use the loan to purchase more materials for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dinah plans to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: Purchase more materials for resale.

loans.name: Berlyn Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Berlyn tiene 43 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación, tiene un hijo 14 años de edad que estudia, su esposo es taxista en la ciudad de Managua, el negocio de doña Berlyn es la venta de cosméticos y perfúmenes desde hace siete años, inicio con ayuda de su esposo y con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo, este es su sexto ciclo el cual va invertir en productos variados de pinturas, perfumes, cremas y otros mas que sastifagan el gusto y la necesidd del cliente. Da gracias Afodenic por que gracias a sus préstamos se ha beneficiado tanto en lo personal como en su negocio. Sus planes es poder crecer en sus ventas y lograr la captación de clientes.
texts.en:
Berlyn is 43 years old and lives in the town of Reconciliación. She has a 14-year-old son who is currently in school. Her husband is a taxi driver in Managua. For seven years, Berlyn has sold cosmetics and perfumes. She started her business with her husband's help and with loans from [Kiva partner] Afodenic. This is her sixth loan, which she plans to use for various products, such as makeup, perfume, lotion and others that her clients will like and need. Berlyn is thankful for Afodenic, seeing Afodenic's loans have greatly benefited her personally, as well as in her business. She hopes to be able to increase her sales and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and a variety of makeup products

loans.name: Angelica Victoria

texts.es: La señora Angélica T. de 32 años de edad, con residencia en el Paraje Pajumujuyup, Cantón Chuisuc, Totonicapán, persona emprendedora, en la actualidad cuenta con una su pequeña tienda de consumo diario anexo venta de comida rápida, cuenta con 2 años de experiencia, debido a la demanda de los estudiantes la persona no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir su tienda, por la cual se acerco a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo para incrementar  el capital de la tienda ya que con ello podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angelica T. is 32 years old; she resides in the Paraje Pajumujuyup, Cantón Chuisuc, Totonicapán. She is an enterprising person, and currently has a small shop that sells food staples as well as fast food. She has 2 years experience, due to the needs of her two school age children she does not have the capital needed to supply her store, for that reason she approached the ASDIR Association to apply for a loan to increase the capital she can use for her store, with the loan she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comerce (increase capital)

loans.name: Isolda  Adilia

texts.es: La joven Isolda tiene 24 años de edad, vende variedad como golosinas, gaseosas, pan, también vende comida los fines de semana para obtener otros ingresos, reside en Villa Venezuela, y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en electricidad. Con esta solicitud va invertir en comprar granos básicos, jabón, carnes y otros productos de consumo diario para cubrir las necesidades del cliente. Con esto espera vender mas, tener mejores ganancias, sus planes es poder mejorar la  infraestructura del negocio para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isolda is 24 years old. She sells a variety of products, such as sweets, soft drinks and bread. She also sells food on weekends for extra income. She lives in Villa Venezuela and has a 5-year-old son. Her husband is an electrical worker. Isolda plans to use this loan to purchase bulk grains, soap, meat and other daily-use products her clients need. She expects to sell more products and increase her income, and hopes to refurbish her business to serve her clients better.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk grains, meat, soap and other products

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon B. is 55 years old. He is married to two different wives who have given birth to thirteen children. According to him, some of his kids are in school; senior high, junior high and basic schools. Others are into apprenticeships.

His wives are into trading. He is a farmer and a trader. Solomon lives with his children and wives in a family house in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Solomon trades in food stuffs such as maize and palm nuts. He also sells fruits such as oranges, banana, etc. Solomon buys some of his goods from wholesalers in the community and others from farmers in nearby villages. He sells at the local market to food vendors. Solomon also distributes to retailers.

He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure food stuffs in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. Solomon hopes to sponsor his children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure food items to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Since 1999, Margaret A. has sold provisions such as gari, groundnuts and beans at Moree market, near Cape Coast.

She is single with two children and has received schooling through senior high. Margaret uses her income to pay for utilities and food.

Margaret will use this loan to purchase more provisions from Techiman for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to expand the capital base of the business.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Silvia Y., se dedica  a crianza de pollos de granja, cuenta con 2 años de experiencia  casada con 2 hijos que estudian, persona entusiasta y con esos deseos de mejorar su condición de vida, por la cual se acerco a ala asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, crédito que utilizara para la compra de mas pollos de granja y con ello ampliara su crianza de pollos, reconocida en su comunidad como una persona transparente, responsable y amable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Y. has been raising chickens for 2 years. She is married with 2 children who are in school. She is an enthusiastic person and with these desires to improve her standard of living, she has approached the ASDIR association to ask for a loan. The loan will be used to buy more chickens and she will expand the number of chickens she raises. She is known in her community as a very open, responsible, and friendly person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es: La señora Jerobia tiene 45 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, prendas y es costurera, lleva nueve años en las ventas, el cual inicio con ahorros, la costura la aprendió desde muy joven, el cual ha sido una fuente de ingreso para su familia. Reside en Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos de 6,15 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es electricista. Este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic que quiere para hacer un muro en su casa para reguardar su seguridad para su familia. Su objetivo es comprar otra maquina para hacer los bordados modernos y captar clientes.
texts.en:
Jerobia is 45 years old. For nine years, she has sold cosmetics and clothing and worked as a seamstress. She started her business with her savings. She learned how to sew as a young girl. Now her skill has become a source of income for her family. Jerobia lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has three children, ages 6, 15 and 20. Her husband is an electrician. This is Jerobia's eighth loan with [Kiva partner] Afodenic, which she is requesting to build a wall in her house to increase her family's security. Jerobia would like to purchase another sewing machine so she can make contemporary embroideries and attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for building a wall

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana N. is 42 years old. She is married with five children; two sons and three daughters. Her children are in senior and junior high schools, and primary school. Her husband is a farmer and a business man. Joana is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

She trades in food items such as yams and beans. Joana procures tubers of yams and beans from farmers in her area and nearby communities. Joana has been in this business for two years. She treks to other markets to sell.

Joana wants a loan to procure more tubers of yams and beans. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels and expand her business.

loans.use: Buy more yams and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 45 years old. She is married with six children; two males and four daughters. Some of her children are in junior high and basic schools. Others are in senior high school.

Her husband is a farmer, while she is a trader. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Mary trades in food stuffs such as plantain, rice and yams. She also sells tomatoes, vegetable cooking oil, onions, etc. She buys some of her goods from wholesalers in her community and others from farmers in nearby villages, and sells at the local market to food vendors. She also distributes to retailers.

Mary has been in this business for fifteen good years and wants a loan to procure food stuffs in bulk to be able to supply to more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure food stuffs in bulk.

loans.name: Santos Angela

texts.es: La señora Santos Ángela M. T., es de 43 años de edad, cuenta con su taller de elaboración de playeras, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia,  con el trabajo que realiza sostiene a su familia ya que su esposo no los ayuda a sufragar los gastos de la familia, señora emprendedora reconocida en su comunidad amable y responsable, la cual en la actualidad  requiere de incrementar su capital, en donde se acerco a la asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo para poder ampliar su taller y cubrir un pedido de playeras y con ello podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos Ángela M. T. is 43 years old and has a shop where she has been making t-shirts for 5 years and with this work supports her family as her husband doesn’t help defray the household expenses. She is a hard-working businesswoman known in her community as being friendly and responsible. She needs to increase her capital so she has approached ASDIR to ask for a loan to be able to expand her shop and cover and complete an order of t-shirts with which she will be able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to make t-shirts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Since 1999, Rose N. has sold provisions such as gari, maize, groundnuts and beans at Moree market, near Cape Coast.

She is married with four children, and her husband is a carpenter. Rose is responsible for paying utilities, school fees and food. Her loan will be used to buy more goods from Techniman for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: Buy more goods to resell to build a house.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is 32 years old.  She is married with two children; sons.  Both are in school, junior high school and primary school.  Her husband is a farmer, while she is a food vendor.  She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

She cooks and sells rice and stew.  Vida cooks the food in her house and sells in front of her house in the mornings. Vida buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community.  She has been in this business for eight years. 

Vida wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Marina,

texts.es:
Hace un año que Marina se dedica a la venta de ropa bajo pedido, tanto de segunda mano como de primera. Anteriormente a este trabajo ella era obrera en una fábrica de frascos matizados. Estuvo ocho años aquí hasta que decidió retirarse pues el trabajo era muy pesado, trabajaba doce horas al día, la empresa no cubría seguros de vida y no tenia quien cuide de sus hijos.

Por este motivo pensó en que independizarse y trabajar por su cuenta seria mejor. Previo a su trabajo en aquella fábrica ella le dedico veinte años de su vida a su trabajo como conserje en los laboratorios Farmalab. Trabajo que abandonó luego de que la empresa quebrara. 

Ahora, a pesar de las dificultades de la fábrica de frascos, trabaja eventualmente aquí, cuando los ingresos por su negocio de ropa no le son suficientes. 

Marina tiene siete hijos, de los cuales cinco ya son independientes. Solo esta su cargo sus hijos de quince y de diez años.
texts.en:
For one year Marina hs been dedicated to selling cheap clothing, both second hand and new. Before this work she was a worker in a bottle factory. She was there eight yeers until she decided to retire because the work was very heavy, she worked twelve hours a day, the wage didn't cover her living expenses, and she didn't have anyone to take care of her children. For these reasons she thought about becoming independent and working for herself would be better. Before her job in that factory she had dedicated twenty years of her life to her job as a caretaker in the Farmalab laboratories, a job which she left after the factory closed. Now, despite the difficulties of the bottle factories, she still works there when the income from her clothing business is not enough for her. Marina has seven children, of whom five are already independent. She is only responsible for her five year old and ten year old children.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa S. is 40 years old. She is married with four children; two males and two females. All are in junior high and basic schools. She is a trader. Adwoa lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is farmer.

Adwoa trades in game meat. She procures the fresh meat from hunters in nearby villages, smokes it and sells at the local market. She distributes mostly to food vendors in her community. Adwoa also treks to other markets to sell on their market days.

Adwoa has been in this business for five years. She wants a loan to procure game meat in bulk to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: Procure game meat in bulk.

loans.name: Maricela Evangelina

texts.es: La Señorita Maricela Evangelina B.   con 24 años de edad, soltera, de oficios Sastre “elaboración de ropa para bebes” cuenta con un taller pequeño  habita junto a su madre, lleva 5 años de elaborar  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuipachec, cantón juchanep, Totonicapán, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela es muy poca el cual es obligado a cambiar de oficios la condiciones  económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda incrementar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia para la confección para ropa de bebes y de esa manera poder ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maricela Evangelina B., 24, single and living with her mother, is a taylor of baby clothes and has a small workshop. She has been making apparel for five years at her home in Paraje Chuipachec, Junachep district, Totonicapan, department of Totonicapan, Guatemala.

The current demand of her customers is very little which is forcing her to change her occupation, and her economic conditions are not enough to increase her capital; this is the reason why she went to ASDIR association, to ask for a loan to purchase raw materials for baby clothes and in this way help support her family.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw material for baby clothing

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Y. is 36 years old. She is married with two children. Both are in school; junior high and the basic schools. She is a seamstress by profession. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Beatrice owns a shop in which she works. She procures all kinds of materials from Kumasi and sews many designs for sale. She also sews for clients who come with their own materials. Beatrice has some apprentices who are in training. According to her, a number of the apprentices have graduated and run their own businesses. She has been in the business for twenty years.

She wants a loan to procure more materials and other sewing accessories. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure more fabrics and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu I. is 38 years old. He is a married man with three children. Adamu says as a married man, he needs to work very hard to make some income to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Adamu owns a poultry farm. He procures birds – chicks, layers and broilers from dealers in nearby communities. He sells matured birds at the local market on market days. Adamu also treks to sell in markets in nearby communities.

He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure more birds. He is hopeful to expand his business.

loans.use: Procure more birds.

loans.name: Francisca Cristina

texts.es: Doña Francisca es una mujer luchadora que desde muy joven  se ha dedicado al trabajo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar, ya que es madre soltera de dos hijos uno de 25 que es independiente y uno de 16 años que cursa la secundaria, tiene 64 años de edad, reside en el barrio Walter Ferreti, y se desempeña de conserje desde hace vientres años. Cansado pero es una oportunidad para subsistir. Con esta solicitud quiere comprar materiales de construcción ya que desea embaldosar su casa ya que su piso es de suelo, y desea estar un poco más cómoda y higiénica. Su anhelo es ver a su hijo que sea un profesional
texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking woman who, since she was very young, has dedicated herself to her work to be able to provide for her family. She is a single mother of two children -- one who is 25 and living on his own, and the other, age 16, who is in high school. Francisca is 64 years old and lives in the Walter Ferretti neighborhood [of Managua]. For 20 years she has worked as a caretaker and has grown tired, but it provides means for getting by. With the requested loan she wants to buy construction materials for installing tiles in her house. Her current floor is earthen and Francisca would like to be a little more comfortable and keep her home clean. She hopes to see her son grow up to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for tiling the floor of her house

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: Doña María Lacán cuenta con 47 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Pants” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto a con  sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar pants en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. María Lacán is 47, married, and a seamstress of sweat suits. She has a workshop with three machines. She lives with her two children; they all work in the same activity and have two more employees.

She has been making sweat suits for 18 years in Paraje Xepatriz, district of Nimapa, department of Totonicapan, Guatemala..

Her customers’ current demand has increased but her economic conditions are not solid enough to increase the working capital. This is the reason why she came to ASDIR association, to ask for a loan to buy raw materials and, as a consequence, increase her sales to support her children and offer them better living conditions..


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (raw material purchase)

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. is 50 years old. She is widowed with five children; two males and three females. All are in junior high and basic schools. She is a food vendor. Adwoa lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Adwoa prepares and sells sugar Kenkey. It is produced from corn dough. She buys bags of maize from farmers in nearby villages and sells in the local market square. She distributes mostly to retailers. Adwoa has been in this business for five years.

She wants a loan to procure maize in bulk to be able to supply more customers. Adwoa hopes to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of maize.

loans.name: Carmelita Micaela

texts.es: La señora Carmelita B. tiene 47 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto con sus hijos , ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 20 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carmelita B. is a 47-year-old single mother who lives with her children. She owns a workshop equipped with three looms where she makes traditional women’s wear together with her children and another employee. She has been making clothing for 20 years from her home in Paraje Xeatzam in the Nimapá district of the Totonicapán region of Guatemala.

Customer demand has grown, but her current economic situation makes increasing her capital difficult. This is why she turned to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She will use this loan to purchase raw materials that will allow her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth Antonia

texts.es: Doña Elizabeth T. cuenta con 29 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante, “compra y venta de ropa típicas para mujeres” habita junto a  sus 3 hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 6 años en el comercio su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuipachec del Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is 29 years of age, is married and has commercial premises from where she buys and sells traditional women’s clothing. She lives together with her 3 children and they all work together in the business, as they have done for 6 years, which is in their home on Chuipachec Place in the Juchanep region, situated in the department of Totonicapan, Guatemala. Now the demand from her customers has increased but the financial conditions in which she finds herself are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason she approached the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan with the intention of buying merchandise. In this way she will be able to increase her weekly sales and also hopes to be able to offer more opportunities to her children and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her women's clothing business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon D. is married with four children. He has received an education through junior high school.

Simon is a photographer in Moree near Cape Coast, which he has done since 1997. His wife is a seamstress. Simon uses his income to pay for school fees, utilities and rent.

Simon will use the loan to purchase a digital camera in order to increase his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Simon plans to build a house.

loans.use: Purchase a digital camera in order to increase his business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina B. is married with four children. She has received schooling through senior high. Since 2000, Faustina has sold provisions, such as gari, in Cape Coast.

Her husband is employed as a teacher. Faustina uses her income to pay for rent, school fees and utilities.

Faustina will use the loan to purchase goods to expand her business. With the new profits, Faustina plans to buy land.

loans.use: Purchase goods to sell to buy land.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: Doña María T. cuenta con 26 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de ropas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo y su hijo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 4 años  en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chuimenchú del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María T. is 26 years old, married, and works as a merchant. “I purchase and sell traditional clothing for women,” she explains. She lives with her husband (who is also a merchant) and their son. For 4 years now María has run her business out of her home in Paraje Chuimenchú, in the Poxlajuj district of Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. These days her clientele's demand is increasing, but she is finding that she cannot increase her capital due to the current economic conditions. It is for this reason that María has requested a loan from the ASDIR Association (a local Kiva partner). She plans to use the loan to purchase more merchandise and thus to increase her sales. María hopes to be able to support her son and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Doña Ana Rosa es oficial de pizarra en la policía nacional,  desde hace quince años, se ha esforzado para mantener a su familia ya que es madre soltera, tiene una hija mayor de edad y también ayuda a su  mama ya que vive con ellas. La señora Rosa tiene 52 años de edad, reside en el barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua. El crédito que esta solicitando  es para hacer mejoras a su vivienda en la compra de perlinez y zin para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado. Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por los beneficios que ha mejorado para su familia. Sus metas es seguir dando su servicio de trabajo a la policía nacional y al país, para poder reducir la delincuencia y el abuso a los nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is a public official with the National Police. For 15 years, as a singe mother, she has worked hard to take care of her family. Rosa lives with her grown daughter, who also helps her. Rosa is 52 years old and lives in Neighborhood 380 in Managua. The loan she is requesting will be used to refurbish her home by purchasing ceiling beams and zinc sheeting to replace her roof, which is in poor condition. This is Rosa's fourth loan from [Kiva partner] Afodenic. Rosa is thankful for Afodenic for the benefits her family has received. Rosa's goal is to continue serving the National Police and her country with the aim of reducing crime and abuse of Nicaraguan citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceiling beams and zinc sheeting to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Nelson Benjamin

texts.es: Don Nelson Benjamín García T. cuenta con 54  años de edad, es casado y se dedica a la artesanía, elaborando cortes típicos  habita junto a su esposa conjuntamente con sus 5 hijos tiene de experiencia 20 años de elaborar en esta actividad con residencia en el Paraje Pacoc, del Cantón Xantun, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima para poder generar ganancias para su empresa y así poder darles a su familia una vida mejor, ya que con ello les está dando estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson Benjamín García T. is 54 years old and is married. He is a craftsman, and he makes typical garments. He lives with his wife and 5 children. He has 20 years of experience making garments. He lives in Paraje Pacoc of Cantón Xantun in the Totonicapán zone of Guatemala. Customer demand has grown. Due to his current economic conditions he does not have enough capital. This is why he went to the Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan. He will buy raw materials for his business to be able to generate more income. He will be able to give his family a better life and his children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts - to buy raw materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Y. is single with four children and has received an education through senior high school.

She sells gari, beans and groundnuts in Moree market near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2005. The sacks she is standing beside contain some of the items she trades.

Beatrice uses her income to pay for school fees and will use the loan to purchase more gari, beans and groundnuts, from Techiman for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beatrice plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Buy more food to expand her business.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carlota tiene 58 años de edad, reside en San Judas en la ciudad de Managua, con tres hijos, los cuales trabajan para apoyar a su familia, su  negocio es una pulpería que con mucho esfuerzo logro a poner para tener sus propios ingresos ya que es viuda y no tiene un apoyo. Inicio con fondos propios. Su objetivo es comprar mercadería variada para surtir la pulpería con productos enlatados, productos lácteos,  y carnes. Para ofertar  a sus clientes. Sus metas es incrementar el volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Carlota is 58 years-old and resides in San Judas in the city of Managua. She lives with her three children, who work to support their family. Her business is a general store which with a lot of effort allowed her to have her own income since she is a widow and does not have support. She began her business with her own funds. Her objective is to buy various merchandise to supply the grocery store with canned goods, dairy products, and meats to offer to her clients. Her goals are to increase the volume of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned goods, dairy products, soda, and meats

loans.name: Vincentia

texts.en:
Vincentia E. is married with one child and received an education through senior high school.

Vincentia sells gari and maize in Moree, near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Her husband is a business man. Vincentia uses her income to pay for school fees.

Vincentia will use the loan to buy gari and maize, from Techiman, for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vincentia plans to give a quality education to her child.

loans.use: Buy food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Eriberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Eriberto se desempeña en una constructora de arca de mantenimiento , trabajo que desde hace cuatro años labora para esta institución, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa tiene su propio negocio una pulpería que es de mucha sastifaccion para su familia sus hijos están casados. Con este crédito quiere aumentar el tamaño del cuarto ya que es pequeño y le resulta incomodo para eso va a comprar materiales de construcción y da las gracias  Afodenic por ser parte de sus metas alcanzadas, este es su décimo crédito y espera tener la oportunidad de seguir mejorando su vivienda para digna.
texts.en:
Eriberto works for a construction company. For four years Eriberto has worked for this institution. He is 56 years-old and lives in the neighborhood Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. His wife has her own business, a grocery store that is of much satisfaction to the family. Their children are married. With this loan, Eriberto would like to increase the size of a room since it is small and uncomfortable. For this reason, he is going to buy construction materials. He gives thanks to Afodenic for being part of the goals he has achieved. This is his tenth loan, and he hopes to have the opportunity to continue improving his home for the best.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an annexed room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains, canned goods, and soda

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipe surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : Venta de Ropas, Venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa, peluqueria, venta de comidas, taller de costuras y otros . El monto que recibe cada señora varía de 300.000 a 1.800.000, todas las señoras destinan el crédito para las actividades que ya estan realizando actualmente. 

1.	Porfiria S. Rolón- Venta de Comestibles
2.	Celia M. Villalba- Despensa
3.	Alba P.- Despensa
4.	Agustina Fernández- Venta de Peluches
5.	María Silvia M. – Venta de Comestibles
6.	María Antonia S.- Venta de mercaderias comestibles
7.	Graciela C.- Venta de comestibles
8.	Nimia A. Soto- Despensa
9.	Juana S. Rolon- Pasera 
10.	Valentina Ramírez- Venta de Comestibles 
11.	Candelaria Domínguez- Venta de comidas
12.	Nancy B.- Venta de libros
13.	Luz M. Gauto- Peluqueria
14.	Silvia S. Rolon- venta de ropas
15.	Patricia C.- Venta de comidas
16.	Mirian S.- Taller costuras
17.	Edit C.- cocinera
18.     Emilda C. - Venta de ropas
texts.en:
This group from the Barrio Chaipe came into being because of contact with one of the members of the foundation. All of the women are involved in productive activities such as clothing sales; sale of food; running a grocery store; working as a hairdresser; the sale of meals, running a seamstress shop; and others. The amount each woman will receive varies from 300,000 – 1,800,000 PYG. All of the women will use the loan for their current businesses.

1. Porfiria S. Rolón- Foodstuffs Sales 2. Celia M. Villalba- Grocery Store 3. Alba P.- Grocery Store 4. Agustina Fernández- Stuffed Animal Sales 5. María Silvia M. – Foodstuffs Sales 6. María Antonia S.- Foodstuffs Sales 7. Graciela C.- Foodstuffs Sales 8. Nimia A. Soto- Grocery Store 9. Juana S. Rolon- Transports goods from other countries for retail sales 10. Valentina Ramírez- Foodstuffs Sales 11. Candelaria Domínguez- Sales of Prepared Meals 12. Nancy B.- Book Sales 13. Luz M. Gauto- Hairdresser 14. Silvia S. Rolon- Clothing Sales 15. Patricia C.- Sale of Prepared Meals 16. Mirian S.- Seamstress Shop 17. Edit C.- Cook 18. Emilda C. - Clothing Sales

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes; buy foodstuffs such as flour, oil, noodles, herbs, cigarettes,drinks, meat; to buy cosmetics for hair dressing; to buy books, to buy meat for the making and selling of meals; to buy clothes

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina, tiene 37 años  está casada con el señor Concepción Cabrera que trabaja como plomero por  la zona de la ciudad. Tienen dos hijos  menores de edad y dependientes de ellos. La señora tiene una despensa y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercaderías como por ejemplo: frutas, verduras, panificados, arroz, azúcar, aceite, yerbas entre otros.

Albina se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de  tres años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa. Donde realizo algunas refacciones para montar su salón comercial.

Albina, con las ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con su marido hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Albina comenta que tiene muy buena venta. Es por ello que  desea adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías como frutas, verduras, productos cárnicos, arroz, aceite, azúcar, etc., de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona.
texts.en:
Albina is 37 years old and married to Mr. Concepcion Cabrera. He works as a plumber for a zone of the city. They have two young children that they support. Albina has a small store where she sells all sorts of products like fruits, vegetables, bread, rice, sugar, oil, herbs.

Albina has been selling in this area for more than 3 years. Her shop is located in her home, which underwent some renovations to create her business area. With the profit from her sales, Albina contributes to the household income. Together with her husband they meet the costs of their household.

Albina says that she has very good sales. For this reason, she wants to buy greater quantities of products like fruit, vegetables, meat products, rice, oil, sugar, etc. This way she'll be able to meet the strong demand in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise: rice, sugar, oil, vegetables, fruit, baked goods, and meat

loans.name: Alice

texts.es:
Alice, tiene 42 años  es viuda y es  madre de dos hijos de los cuales ambos son  mayores de edad y trabajan de forma independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo  zapatos por ejemplo: championes (sports shoes), sandalias, zapatos, entre otros.

Alice se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de dos años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa, dónde para esto, ella realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial.

Alice, con sus ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y con la ayuda de sus hijos hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Alice, comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que ella desea adquirir mayor cantidad de zapatos, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde  vive y tiene su salon comercial.
texts.en:
Alice is 42, is a widow, and is the mother of two adult children who work independently. She sells all kinds of shoes such as tennis shoes, sandals, dress shoes, and others. She has done this work for more than two years, and her business is located in her house. She had to make some changes to be able to have enough space to sell in. Alice uses the profits from her sales to support her home, and with the help of her children they face their family expenses. Alice tells us that she has quite a few sales. This is why she wants to acquire a larger quantity of shoes so she can have enough supply for the strong demand that exists in the area where she lives and that her business has.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for women, men, and children

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, con veintisiete años de edad, es madre de un niño de diez años y de una niña de un año. Con el fin de ayudara a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hora, alimentos y crianza de sus hijos, trabaja desde hace diez años. Lavando ropa para otras personas. Luego de unos años empezó a vender ropa bajo pedido trabajo que ha abandonado en parte ya que solo les es rentable cuando los clientes le pagan puntual y completo. Ahora solo vende a personas exclusivas.

Sin pensarlo mucho hace dos años empezó un nuevo negocio, además del lavado y venta de ropa. Una vez, un fin de semana salió a vender anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, como le fue bien decidió tener un puesto y vender con mas frecuencia. Actualmente, Rosmery sale a vender anticuchos inter diario en el paradero más cercano de su casa.  

Lo que ella mas quisiera es poder terminar sus estudios en confección industrial para poder tener un taller propio de costura.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 27 years old, and is the mother of a 10 year-old son and a 1 year-old daughter. She began working 10 years so that she could help her husband cover their expenses, specifically the costs of food and raising their children. She started out washing clothes for other people, and a few years later began selling clothing on demand, but has partially given that up because it is only profitable when her customers pay her on time and in full. Now she only sells to certain people. Two years ago Rosmery decided to start a new business, in addition to her other businesses of washing clothes and selling clothing. One weekend she tried selling anticuchos (grilled beef hearts—a specialty of the Andes) from the front doorway of her home. Because this was successful, she decided to set up a stand and sell anticuchos much more often. Now Rosmery sells anticuchos every day at a place very close to her house. What Rosmery wants most is to be able to finish her studies in clothing production so that she can set up her own sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing shoes and school uniforms for her clothing business, and purchasing basic ingredients for her food business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 50 años  está casado con  la señora Francisca de P. y juntos tienen un hijo que es menor de edad y  dependiente de sus padres. El se dedica al cambio de monedas como por ejemplo (dólar, real, peso argentino, euro, etc.)

Juan se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de seis años. El comenta que tiene su puesto fijo en el centro de la ciudad frente mismo al banco nacional de fomento. El  cuenta con la autorización del directorio del banco nacional de fomento, es decir una resolución para poder trabajar legalmente sin ningún tipo de inconveniente.

Juan, con las ganancias de su trabajo aporta a los ingresos de la casa, junto con su señora hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Juan, comenta que tiene bastantes clientes. Es por ello que él desea adquirir mayor cantidad  de capital para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes y así también mantener la clientela ya formada y seguir aumentando con otros nuevos que se suman a la lista de sus  clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 50-years-old and is married to Francisca de P.; together they have a young son who depends on them. Juan works in currency exchange, dealing in, for example, dollars, reales, Argentinean pesos, euros, etc.

Juan has worked in this field for over six years. He says that he works in the city centre right across from the Banco Nacional de Fomento (National Development Bank). His business is run legally and is authorised by this bank.

Juan contributes his earnings to household expenses; together he and his wife provide for their family.

Juan says that he has plenty of customers, which is why he wants to acquire more capital. This would allow him to both satisfy existing customers and attract new ones.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Josefa De La Cruz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua, la señora Josefa de la Cruz M. con gran ahínco se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación donde atiende muy alegremente. 

El motive por el cual ella acude a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima ya que debe a lo inmediato obtenerlo para así elaborar las tortillas y venderlas en su localidad.
texts.en:
In Nicaragua's capital city of Managua, Josefa de la Cruz M. works with great effort making and selling tortillas. She has her own establishment in her house, where she works very happily. She came to Ceprodel is to procure a loan for the purchase of raw materials, which she needs to make and sell tortillas in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Walter A. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a laborar en su negocio de venta de abarrotes como lo son los granos básicos siendo este su único sustento para él y su familia en la ciudad de Managua.

La razón por la que hoy en día él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos y de esta forma salir adelante manteniendo su núcleo familiar que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Walter A. vigorously works at his business. He sells groceries and basic seeds. This is the only livelihood for him and his family in the city of Managua.

The reason he has come to Ceprodel now is to apply for a loan to buy basic seeds. This way he can get ahead and support his immediate family, which needs his support.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic seeds

loans.name: Bella Maria,

texts.es:
Bella cuenta haber estado siempre en ambiente de negocio, su familia ha sido negociante desde que ella recuerda. Hoy ella maneja una tienda de abarrotes desde hace quince años, como una de las primeras pobladoras de su localidad, no dudó en abrir un negocio, puesto que no había competencia en su zona.

Cuando vivía en su anterior casa tenia diversos negocios, mayormente comercio ambulatorio. Pero como sus hijos eran aún pequeños decidió tener un negocio que le permitiera estar cerca de ellos por más tiempo. 

Además de su tienda de abarrotes también vende cosméticos por catálogo desde hace tres años. Para más adelante ella quisiera implementar su negocio con un pequeño bazar donde también pueda vender sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
Bella says she has always been in a business environment. Her family has been in business since she can remember. She has managed a grocery store for the past 15 years. As one of the first people to live in her town, she didn’t think twice about opening a business since there was no competition in the area.

When she lived in her old house she had different businesses, mainly as a street vendor. But since her children were still little, she decided to have a business that let her be close to them more.

Aside from her grocery store, she has been selling cosmetics from a catalogue for three years. In the future she wants to aid her business with a small shop where she could also sell her cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En la  ciudad de Managua, capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Martha P. dedica su tiempo a la venta de productos de uso domestico siendo este su negocio desde hace 10 años.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión constante, el negocio de la venta de productos de uso domésticos requiere de inversión por lo que debe adquirir los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de estos y así ofertarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
En la ciudad de Managua, capital del bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Martha P. dedica su tiempo a la venta de productos de uso domestico siendo este su negocio desde hace 10 años. Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión constante, el negocio de la venta de productos de uso domésticos requiere de inversión por lo que debe adquirir los productos y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de estos y así ofertarlos en su negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of home products

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de un hijo que es menor de edad y dependiente de ella. La misma cuanta con una librería que tiene montado en su propio domicilio. Tiene venta de todos tipos de útiles escolares como por ejemplo: cuadernos, libros, reglas, pinceles, correctores, cartulinas, entre otros.

Lilian se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de cuatro años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa, dónde para esto, ella realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial y taller.

Lilian, con las ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con sus padres hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Lilian comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de materiales escolares ya que empiezan las clases, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde sale a hacer su venta.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 22 year old mother of a minor, dependent child. She has a bookshop which she set up in her home. She sells all types of school supplies such as notebooks, books, rulers, paintbrushes, markers, and others. Lilian has been in this business for more than four years. Because the shop is in her home, she had to make some modifications to have the space required for her business. With the earnings from her sales she contributes to household expenses. Together with her parents she covers the family expenses. Lilian has enough sales. For this reason she would like a bigger quantity of school supplies. Now that school is starting she could take advantage of the strong demand in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, cards, books, general school supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Hasta hace siete años, Victoria solo dedicaba su tiempo a cuidar de su hogar y de sus cuatro hijos. No obstante, cuando sus hijos fueron creciendo ella se fue liberando también de algunas responsabilidades, por lo que decidió dedicarse tiempo para sí misma y entonces pensó en emprender un negocio propio.

Gracias a una promotora de una empresa de cosméticos Victoria se animó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo. Hoy ya tiene más de cinco años haciéndolo y le va muy bien. Por ello que más adelante le gustaría abrir una tienda-bazar en su casa para poder aumentar la mercadería y vender más productos.
texts.en:
